Reviews.Author: Shaun
Reviews.Content: I can't speak highly enough about this place. If you're coming for the Buffett but come late (after 3pm) like we did, don't be afraid to order their sampler. It's awesome! We had so many things. I'm no pro when it comes to Indian food but the Tandoori chicken was the best I've had out of the ~10 other places I've been. The butter chicken was really good and their.   The service was attentive enough and they didn't make us feel like they were hovering even though there were only a couple of other tables seated. When we were unsure about something, they were patient and pleasant when explaining.

Reviews.Author: Mas
Reviews.Content: I love their buffet. They had briyani when we were there for lunch a few weeks ago. Friendly server.

Reviews.Author: Zooner
Reviews.Content: We are Indian and we loved the food.  We had Paneer Tikka Masala, Bhuna Gosht, fish tandoori tikkas, lacha paratha, and Tasmania for desert.  Every dish seemed to be perfect.  The fish was perfectly cooked, tasty and not over cooked. Two minor things I didn't like:  color added to the planner giving it a bright red color.  Unnecessary in my opinion.  Second the Bhuna Gosht was a bit salty (my wife thought it was perfect), but this is something you can tell them when you place the order. Also I had 2 glasses of the 2008 Perez Cruz Cabernet which I enjoyed.  Just give it time to breathe.

Reviews.Author: A
Reviews.Content: Our cravings were satisfied indeed! Chicken biriyani was amazing (5 stars). Chicken tikka masala with plain naan bread was ideal especially if you only eat chicken breast. I also got free mango lassi was delish!

Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: Got to order the  Mango Lasse  oh, sooooo good! Still the best Indian buffet for it's value and taste. Even the take-out for lunch is a huge portion enough for a big eater like me to have two portions.

Reviews.Author: chris
Reviews.Content: The buffet is only $9.99 and the food is great.  I have been to many of the other buffets in town and this is probably the best.   Add in the free drink with check in and u can't beat it.  This is my go-to place for indian food.

Reviews.Author: Jessica
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed myself here. The atmosphere was nice, the food was delicious, and the waiter did a great job. The chicken Biryani was delicious ! Can't wait to come back and try something else on the menu.

Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: I was craving Indian food so I came here based on recommendations on yelp. the place including the bathroom is very clean. staff is super friendly and nice. the food was excellent. I tried everything on the buffet and they were all tasty. I especially loved the goat curry but I love curry in general. when u sit be sure to ask for garlic naan.  I was searching for saag paneer but it was displayed so I asked and they said they had run out but they made a small bowl for me. it was excellent as well. the buffet is only available for lunch and they temporarily close from 3-5pm so they can change for dinner. I think I found my Indian lunch buffet place. oh it's $10 which is cheaper than other places. I'd definitely be back for sure!!!

Reviews.Author: Xin
Reviews.Content: Delicious briyani, highly recommend  Waiter is very friendly and quality is good  Food is not pricey compared with other food in Vegas

Reviews.Author: Srikumar
Reviews.Content: Hardly any options for veg food and the veg curries were tasteless. Th white rice was not cooked properly and the Nan was cold. i did not like the appetizers or the desert as well. Probably the place was catered to non -veg folks but considering it was buffet i think it should have been better.

Reviews.Author: Brooke
Reviews.Content: If you've been waiting to try this place I suggest you try and see for yourself what Delhi Indian Cuisine is all about. I've only tried 2 other Indian places in my Life both were in Vegas The first was India Oven and the second was Mount Everest. India oven was ok. Wasn't a big fan of that restraunt but then again I was also younger and not interested in broadening my horizons and trying different things. Mount Everest was really good their sweet rice was really yummy but they don't serve Garlic Naan anymore :( at lunch I believer so in comes Delhi.     We came at about 2 and there were 2 parties of people besides us eating here. They have the standard share of Indian offerings my favorite was the Chicken Makhani. It's probably my favorite Indian dish. It's super good especially with the garlic Naan. Free mango lassi with check in so that's also a plus.   Only thing I will skip next time is the Galub Jamun. It's a dessert. Little balls of I think bread in a almost diabetic coma sauce. It's wayyyy too sweet for me.   I hope you last Delhi India cuisine. Just put the sweet rice on the buffet line and I will be extra happy !

Reviews.Author: Mikeal
Reviews.Content: This is one of my favorite restaurants in town.  Definitely the best Indian.   The grilled paneer cubes are amazing.  The buffet is great.  Definitely worth it.  But for an experience you won't forget, go for dinner.  Too many great recommendations to list.  Just go, you won't regret it.

Reviews.Author: Christina
Reviews.Content: We missed the lunch buffet here by minutes, but were so resolved to try this food we stuck it out and came back for dinner hours.  Delhi came recommended to us by a British friend who had spent two years in India as  the best Indian food I've had in America.  That's high praise from someone from the two Indian food capitals of the world (and perhaps having a palate more similar to an American than a native Indian)  The service was almost hilariously attentive since we walked through the door right as the place opened for dinner and it was all but empty.  I love a full water glass though, so even though being asked 10 times during dinner was a bit of an interruption, I can't complain.  I foolishly filled up on delicious samosas at the beginning of our meal, but they were so tasty I can't be sad.  The vegetarian dumpling curry we had was surprisingly tasty.  The cashews in the sauce added such rich, thick, depth of flavor.  It is one of those dishes that makes you think, yeah, this is what I'd eat if I were vegetarian, and I wouldn't miss meat one bit.  ...But, speaking of meat, the butter chicken was an absolute dream. I've never had such perfectly cooked chicken in a curry.  The naan was also on point with a yummy chewy top and a crispy bottom.   To sum up how good the food was, my dining partner and I ended up eating so much of it we promptly went home and took a nap.  Bravo, Delhi Indian Cuisine, bravo.

Reviews.Author: Natasha
Reviews.Content: I am Indian and am disappointed with restaurants' lack of proper flavor 90% of the time.  This place is different.  The lunch buffet gives you tons of options, and the dishes are prepared with care and taste delicious.  The tandoori chicken is moist, the pakoras have great flavor, and the garlic naan was right up there with the best I've ever had.  I'm going back immediately to try some dishes off the dinner menu!  The most telling detail about this place is that every single customer was Indian, not surprising at all for a place of this caliber.

Reviews.Author: Dena
Reviews.Content: This is the best Indian restaurant in Vegas ! I have tried every single one in this city, and I have never been as satisfied as I am here.   The buffet is not only the largest variety of any other Indian buffet in Vegas I have experienced, but it is also extraordinarily fresh and it is the most affordable.   I award my highway recommendation! I bring friends and youngsters here all the time, those who have never tried Indian, and I have only seen the most positive experiences!  Enjoy!

Reviews.Author: Ram
Reviews.Content: I had dinner buffet. Their portion are about average. The food is OK, but nothing special. Its not too greasy, but the palak paneer isn't creamy. Malai kofta is OK. Their dal is OK. Their naan is average. Kind of surprised place has 4.5 stars. I would go here, but wouldn't go out of the way to go here.

Reviews.Author: Amit
Reviews.Content: This was the best restaurant I had food at since long time. Each and everything in buffet was amazing .. Highly recommend here !!

Reviews.Author: Vipul
Reviews.Content: Nice food. Their Garnic naan is good. Its better than few other places in Vegas. Their staff is nice too. Its basically owned by Nepali couple. Buffet is $10.99 plus taxes.

Reviews.Author: Aziz
Reviews.Content: Excellent food .. Excellent staff and service  .. I'd like to come back again .. You have to try butter chicken

Reviews.Author: Swepna
Reviews.Content: We visited vegas for 3 days, on last day we decided to try a different indian restaurant out of the strip and found delhi indian cuisine via yelp, we are glad we tried it out. Food here was simply amazing, yummy and delicious with indian kind of spice level and highly authentic.   We went for lunch buffet - tried idly, sambar, chicken briyani, chicken gravy, reshmi chicken kabob, samosa, pakora, mutter paneer, navarathna kurumah aloo gobi. All the items were too good without any complaints and we truly enjoyed the whole experience.   Dessert - carrot halwa was too good and simply cant stop eating :).   I would recommend anyone visiting vegas to definitely check this out , one of the must eat place. We will absolutely go here during our next visit.

Reviews.Author: Dwayne
Reviews.Content: Some of the best Indian food I've ever had. Clean environment, attentive staff, GREAT FOOD

Reviews.Author: Kit
Reviews.Content: This place got great reviews so I figured I would try it. Well, not going back. 2 stars for the way it looked. The food all had the same spice level. The rice, both of them were really dry. The buffet is in one location that makes for poor circulation of people. Crowded, a lot of screaming children. Thanks but no thanks.

Reviews.Author: Foodie
Reviews.Content: Overall definitely in the top 10% of the Indian restaurants I have eaten at across the country over last 15+ years. Chilli Chicken was really good and non-veg thali was alright. Service was great. I will go here again.

Reviews.Author: Amy
Reviews.Content: My family loved the food.. My kids had the greatest time ever.. We had a wonderful time and the food was amazing ... Thank you Hary for everything .. Amy

Reviews.Author: Hiren
Reviews.Content: Haven't tried any other Indian Restaurants other than Tamna in Las Vegas, the Buffet here, tasted very well, and its cheaper on off-long weekends.

Reviews.Author: Kayre
Reviews.Content: The food and service was absolutely beyond awesome! We enjoyed the whole experience from the decor and ambiance to the service and food! I highly recommend this restaurant if you visit Las Vegas!

Reviews.Author: Corwin
Reviews.Content: I decided to try this place's lunch buffet so I could get a good idea of what they offered.  While there were a few good dishes on the buffet, I guess the flavors weren't quite what I expected. Also, the paneer was really quite hard and the pakora was over cooked and more hard than crispy. The goat curry was quite good, but I don't think I could justify coming back for just that. They may have a lot of selections, but having less selections and concentrating on quality might be the better way to go.  I must say, the service is very good and their attentiveness is outstanding. It's something the other Indian lunch buffets here in Vegas could really use.

Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: By far one of the best restaurants in Las Vegas! We eat here frequently, never disappointed, great service!

Reviews.Author: Saurin
Reviews.Content: AVOID!  Visiting from Texas and had an extremely bad experience two days in a row.  First day we order food and waited for 45 mins without a single dish on the table.  Since we were in no position to go anywhere else and just wanted to eat indian food, we asked it to be packed and get to-go and were told we will have our food shortly.  After waiting for nearly an hour, we proceeded to walk out at which point the food was being brought to us.  After taking the food back to the hotel, we noticed there were several items missing.    Experience on Day 2 was similar with order placed for to-go and waiting for 40 minutes.  During our wait, we noticed two families walking out in a similar manner as we had on a previous day and also observed some patrons without menu and water for a long period of time.  Once again, we received the food after 45 minutes and took it back to the hotel.  AND THE ORDER WAS WRONG AGAIN!    Food quality was just above par, it wasn't anything special.  Just slightly better than the popular indian place off the strip.  Overall, I will not be visiting this restaurant again.

Reviews.Author: T.C.
Reviews.Content: Great buffet, everything was good but the Chili Chicken was to die for, the best I've ever had. They could have made it everything spicier for my taste but it was still very nice. The free Nan was ok, I've had better but for the price it was fine. I'll be back when I visit Vegas again.

Reviews.Author: Deepthi
Reviews.Content: Worst veg food ever. Everything tasted bad..and they are not courteous. I wouldn't go again .

Reviews.Author: Trinadh
Reviews.Content: Tried the place on new year day 2016. Biryani is horrible.. and friedrice too. Only thing liked is mango lassi. Not sure how does it get a 4+ rating.

Reviews.Author: Riley
Reviews.Content: Surprisingly empty on a Friday night, but the food was stellar! We had the chicken Nepali Momo as an appetizer, Chicken Tikka Masala, and an excellent Baingain Bharta which they recognized from our confused description and prepared even though it wasn't on the menu. Unfortunately we're only passing through Vegas. I'd definitely be a regular if they were located in my hometown!

Reviews.Author: Kalpesh
Reviews.Content: Delicious yummy food.  Loved Malai kofta, palak paneer, kali  daal, aloo tiki, samosa, chilli paneer.  Must try their falooda kulfi.  Very good services.  Their garlic naan is must try.  Found out that they serve jain food too. Love it....

Reviews.Author: Nethanya
Reviews.Content: I haven't been to many Indian places in Vegas, because this place is awesome. What makes them extremely memorable is their daily lunch buffets. They've got a wide variety of vegetarian and non-vegetarian options to select from and their lassies are super flavorful! Dinner a la carte options are great too. Can't go wrong with anything. The only reason they didn't get a 5 star rating is for their spice level. As of lately, the lunch buffet has been getting too spicy to the point where it's difficult to enjoy the food's flavor, and at dinner time they let a bit of the spice slide a tad bit when you customize your spice level.

Reviews.Author: Scott
Reviews.Content: Went during the lunch buffet and not a bad item was tasted! Everything was delicious and prepared as it should be. For the cost it is a tremendous bargain. I will definitely be going again! Also, try the garlic naan! Yum!

Reviews.Author: Lainie
Reviews.Content: By far, Not the best Indian Lunch Buffet I have ever been to.  Staff was cold and less than accommodating,  and even less welcoming.  The Room was crammed, packed and bustling busy .  Atmosphere was loud and uninviting.  The food was not terrible, but taking the staff and room into consideration it was definitely less than stellar.  I am certainly NOT interested in returning.

Reviews.Author: Reena
Reviews.Content: Came here for lunch buffet on Sunday afternoon. Being from the bay area we are very familiar with Indian buffets and we were pleasantly surprised by this place. It is clean and has a lot of great selections for both vegetarians and non-vegetarians. In terms of veg selections I remember seeing samosas, pakoras, palak paneer, chole, dal makhani, malai kofta, idli sambar, gulab jamun, salad, naan, rice, indo/chinese noodles. A lot of options. I particularly enjoyed the malai kofta and the palak paneer. I'd come back again if in Vegas and craving Indian food.   Note: $18 taxi ride from Vdara to Delhi Indian Cuisine (take Uber instead b/c it will most likely be cheaper).

Reviews.Author: Jette
Reviews.Content: It's my second time eating India food,  it's very good a different level of spicy then I'm use to but I was still able to enjoy the flavors of the food. I really enjoyed the  okra dish and their chicken rice dish. I will recommended and eat there again.

Reviews.Author: Stella
Reviews.Content: This is the first Indian restaurant/buffet that I've been to where I wasn't stiffed on meat. My butter chicken actually fed 3 people! Expect to wait about 20mins longer to get take-out because the tandoori chicken has to be cooked fresh. Here's the breakdown of my order:  Chicken Tandoori - was a bit dry but still tasty Korma Shrimp - was really good too, I saved all the sauce so I can slather my rice in them the next day Butter Chicken - tasty as always and had enough meat to feed 3 people Garlic Naan - not as garlicky as I would have wanted Chicken Pakora - not a fan, dry and not that tasty Veg Samosa - not a fan, too doughy, not enough filling

Reviews.Author: S
Reviews.Content: It was just OK. Ive definitely had better Indian food before (not in Vegas but back home in the UK).  Lets just say, I wont be ordering from here again lol. I ordered a Lamb curry/biriyani

Reviews.Author: Tahira
Reviews.Content: Food is pretty decent, prices are reasonable, and Harry (the manager) takes care of customers very nicely. Halal. Lunch buffet is $12 and has a wonderful selection. Restaurant is nice decor, clean, great service.

Reviews.Author: Sujal
Reviews.Content: Buffet was half empty all the time. People were racing for the naan. No entree tasted good. In short other than naan, nothing good to eat here. Very displeased.

Reviews.Author: Jackie
Reviews.Content: The best Indian food we've ever had! Thank you Yelp for helping us find this place.  Everything was SO delicious. Some of my favorites were:  - Palak paneer (spinach/cheese) had the perfect amount of spiciness, so delish!  - Tandoori chicken was so juicy and smokey, not dry like other places.   - The goat meat in the goat curry was so tender and flavorful.   Can't wait to come back next Vegas trip.

Reviews.Author: Nicole
Reviews.Content: Yes! Finally, a good Indian place!  I went for their lunch buffet and everything was soooo tasty! Included in ur lunch buffet is plenty of Naan. They also have ,my fav, Samosas within the buffet. So, u kno I had to grab two. Everyone working was super nice. They even were gushing over my baby, which I think is really sweet.   The only thing negative thing I can say isn't really a big deal. But, it was super stuffy in there. There was condensation on the windows haha. But soooo worth it. Maybe in the summertime not so much. Locals know.

Reviews.Author: Sr
Reviews.Content: Whenever I come to Las Vegas this is where me and my Indian friends come to eat.  The food is great the service is impeccable also the owner is a great guy. I threw a surprise party for my wife at Vdara they were kind enough to cater this event for my wife at the last minute everyone was raving about the food I would encourage anyone who visits Las Vegas to stop by and have a Taste of India

Reviews.Author: Josh
Reviews.Content: I am very impressed with this restaurant!  The service we received was first class.  The food blew my mind with the flavors and overall quality.  This is the best Indian cuisine in Las Vegas!

Reviews.Author: Angela
Reviews.Content: This was a very pretty Indian restaurant in a not SO good location.  The food was good, as was the service.  However the portions were extremely small and the prices were high for what we got.   Our recommendation for Indian is Mount Everest.  Good portions, quality, service  and the right price for us!

Reviews.Author: Mitsy
Reviews.Content: First time eating here and the wait staff was awesome help! The food was very well prepared! Will defiantly be back!

Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: Great food affordable prices. Really can't go wrong with their lunch buffet. Their Garlic Naan is amazing!

Reviews.Author: Jennifer
Reviews.Content: Went to dinner with my husband and was blown away by both the service and the food! The staff was very friendly and knowledgeable. There were two managers on and both of them checked on us which is always nice. The food was phenomenal! Our server recommended the Vindaloo and told us the Tikka Masala was their most popular do we tried both, and while both were good the Vindaloo was out of this world! We will be going back soon and I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Author: Yash
Reviews.Content: horrible food, i was given the food which was left in the buffet , the chicken tandoori was so hard to chew one can say it is warmed up again in the microwave, tikka masala chicken was same .  worst experience and horrible food i would recommend  curry leaf

Reviews.Author: Vandana
Reviews.Content: Food was authentic Indian. Liked much  the goat and chicken curry n naan. Can't forget the taste really yummy

Reviews.Author: Arman
Reviews.Content: I'm speechless. I live in northern California we have lots of  Indian restaurants here but, nothing came close to this restaurant as far as the food quality and the tastes. Great customer service and beyond. Can't wait to come back and try the food again. And It was so good that I went 3 time during my stay in Vegas.

Reviews.Author: Bill
Reviews.Content: Went here with my wife for the lunch buffet, no wait at all to sit down and immediately asked what kind of naan we wanted (Garlic or Butter). We each went up to the buffet and there was a large selection of different foods, I loaded up on Chicken Tikka Masala, basmati rice and vegetable samosas.   The chicken was delicious and not dry on the middle as some other places I've been to that don't let there chicken sit in the sauce for too long, this was deliciously juicy throughout. The garlic naan was delicious as well and complimented the meal nicely. I had a couple other things from the buffet that I've never had before and all was nicely cooked. We left after filling up on one plate each, both wanting to go back for more but knew better. Final bill was about $23 total for two (both drank water).

Reviews.Author: Ajit
Reviews.Content: I could have given this a better rating - but I went here for a lunch buffet and they had 5 entrees in the non-veg section which I cannot venture into. It was Christmas and we were on our way to the airport. So we picked this restaurant for lunch. I went by the star rating in my Google search.  The idly was soft and sambar tasted pretty good. I heard lot of people talk about the Gulab Jamuns here. So I made sure I checked them out. Again they were very soft. But a bit sweet even for me. The veg curries were good and the nan was ok. And I should not forget the starters. They were good.

Reviews.Author: E
Reviews.Content: Excellent food, super friendly service, incredible price. Chicken Biryani was very good. Possibly one of my favorite buffet to date. Take a break from Casino Buffets and go here.

Reviews.Author: Amarish
Reviews.Content: One off the worst Indian restaurant I visited. For new visitors, please dont go there better go to other restaurant. The 4.5 start ratting is fake.

Reviews.Author: Paria
Reviews.Content: Brought my friend here for her birthday and we both loved it! Definitely coming back.

Reviews.Author: Lars
Reviews.Content: I eat a lot of Indian food in Sweden, where I live, but this was better than most of it.  My choice was the Vegetarian Thal and it was excellent. costed only a bit more than a sandwich and a coffee at Starbucks on the Strip, earlier that day. :)

Reviews.Author: Linda
Reviews.Content: Great butter chicken and curry goat.  And the roti is addictive and fresh you have to ask for it. I will definitely be taking my guest their brunch is from 11 to 3. Great price.

Reviews.Author: E
Reviews.Content: Good service. Nice selection. Flavorful. Generous naan portions. I was happy with them. Reasonable price too. Strong competition to India palace.

Reviews.Author: Varun
Reviews.Content: Worst food that u will ever experience. Cold food, breads were uncooked. Long waiting time.  I am actually shocked to see this restro have a rating this high.

Reviews.Author: Karen
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed a delicious dinner here. Can't wait to come again and enjoy the lunch buffet. Chicken tikka was fabulous as was the chicken kadhai. Okra masala was delicious.   I suggest you give the kashmiri naan a try.  It was to die for.

Reviews.Author: Manav
Reviews.Content: We had a very good time here, the service was excellent. Our waiter (Krishna) took really good care of us.  They have a great variety of vegetarian as well as non veg.  If you are into non veg I would highly recommend the tandoori chicken, it was juicy and spicy and very well cooked.  The Navratan kurma was wonderful and the shaai paneer was great.  The kulfi is homemade so definitely try that,  it was great.

Reviews.Author: Nic
Reviews.Content: I stumbled upon this place by accident and I'm so happy I did... It's exceptionally clean inside and the staff is very helpful and friendly! Nice linen table clothes and napkins... It feels like a very nice restaurant. The food is great!! Best palak paneer I've had in a restaurant! The chicken biryani is great!! All the food I tried was delicious. I can't wait to return for the food, friendly service and classy ambiance.

Reviews.Author: Audrea
Reviews.Content: Diamond in the rough. Fantastic food and exceptional service. We had dinner tonight and we will go back tomorrow for lunch:-) Thank you for the wonderful experience.

Reviews.Author: Sunil
Reviews.Content: Excellent lunch buffet. They offer both meat and vegetarian options for the buffet. Large dinning area with plenty of space.

Reviews.Author: Fiona
Reviews.Content: First time coming here for the lunch and it enjoyed it better than other indian buffets that I have been to.  There is a large selection of food that takes up the back wall. You have a choice between regular or garlic nan, I prefer the garlic one.   Most tandoori chicken at other places are usually dry, but this one was nice and tender!  Definitely worth trying out (:

Reviews.Author: Jerome
Reviews.Content: Sometimes we don't act like tourists when we are tourists but like to go where the locals go.  This buffet for lunch was a great deal, and it must really be, because it was full of indians eating there , except for us.  I loved the tandoori chicken which was moist inside and spicy outside.  The garlic naan was delivered to our table piping hot, so I used it to soak up my curry sauce on the curry chicken and the sauce on a remarkable goat  meat dish. They had steamed white rice and biryani, take your choice.  I wish my stomach was bigger. I'm going back again next Vegas trip, also note: clean bathroom and lots of parking.

Reviews.Author: C
Reviews.Content: Oh boy!  My sister found a great South Indian Buffet in Vegas (via yelp, of course!) Fantastic buffet spread!  I especially like that they have Chicken Biryani, Saag, Dhal, Butter Chicken, the most tender Tandoori Chicken and lots of other items too many to mention.  All were good!  There were 2 kinds of naan brought to the table and helped me to try out all the different curries in the buffet.  Eat all dishes with bites of the split jalapeno peppers.  Sure adds that heat in the food.  Dessert was gulab jamun and kheer.    Will be back!

Reviews.Author: Yash
Reviews.Content: Took over an hour to get 2 Cold entrees and Half cooked Naans for dinner (not buffet). With regards to taste, its average. Samosas were bland. Dal Makhani was OK and Paneer Tikka Masala is nice. Garlic naan was awful. Portions size is below average. I'd give it a miss and try something else next time.

Reviews.Author: Swtzee
Reviews.Content: Went here on a Friday night around dinner time. Thought the place was closed because there was only 1 other patron dining. The server was a bit weird, awkward, and his English wasn't the best. Everyone (staff) else seemed weird and different as well. However, the food was very delicious and fresh. We ordered chicken tikka masala and a chicken kabob style with a yellow rice. The food was flavorful and tasted great.

Reviews.Author: JG
Reviews.Content: Decided to give this a place a try during  Dinner Service .  As we entered we quickly noticed the emptiness.   1st Started with an Appetizer,  Chicken Pakora  ($6) for drinks we ordered the Mango Lassi (1 free via Yelp check-in) Very delicious!  it's like biting into a very ripe mango!  My Wife ordered the  Authentic Chicken Curry   ($14), I had the  Prawn Xacuti  ($21)......  The problem with this place is that they use the same  Base Sauce , the Sauce used for the Prawn Xacuti and Chicken Curry dishes tasted the same!, only difference was color and spice level , that's it!  Initially I was going to try the Non-Vegetarian Delhi Thali but was told by waiter that the Chef  did not time for that  so I chose the  Prawn Xacuti  .   The portions regardless of dish/price are the same.   Once our food arrived we really couldn't eat peacefully as the waiting staff were constantly asking if the food was OK, like every few minutes, I avoided making eye contact after the 2nd time, I just wanted to eat the freaking food! this place was a total disappointment guess the Wife and I should of just done the Buffet, but No Thanks, you only get to disappoint us once! We will never return!

Reviews.Author: Mayuri
Reviews.Content: Lunch buffet had cold food and very less options. Bland food. Only good was fresh lime soda.

Reviews.Author: James
Reviews.Content: Last night was my first time at this establishment and I was not at all disappointed. The food was stellar and the staff were charming. I over ordered and took home far more than we managed to eat. I will be back very soon.

Reviews.Author: Ahmad
Reviews.Content: Delhi Indian Cuisine was the second Indian buffet that we tried during our last trip to Vegas. It is located not too far from the south end of the strip so location and accessibility was not a problem. Upon entering my first impression was that the place seemed pretty inviting. It was spacious with the buffet nicely spread out along the far end, tables nicely spaced apart so after having eaten in Mount Everest the previous day this was a welcome change.  The buffet again has all the standard items that you will find in an Indian buffet. Appetizers included tandoori chicken, vegetable pakodas (vegetable fritters) and samosa (puff pastry with potato filling). Entrees included butter chicken, goat curry, saag, rice, biryani and noodles. Desert included gajar ka halwa (carrot pudding) and kheer (sweetened rice pudding with milk). Taste wise what stood out to me was that everything was good but not great. Well the biryani and naan (provided fresh on the table) were both excellent but all the entrees were enjoyable but nothing popped out. The deserts could have been better. The gajar ka halwa cried out for some more mava (heavy cream) and the kheer for more sugar. Obviously they were made keeping the health conscience, not too sweet regulars in mind (another resturant which was full of locals).   Service was good, all our plates were cleared promptly and price wise it was $10.99 which is pretty much standard for Indian buffets.  Overall I feel that the food surely needs a shot in the arm, but considering the overall package of location, decor, service and value for money a repeat visit is surely on the cards during our next visit.

Reviews.Author: Emma
Reviews.Content: The food was incredible. Flavorful, very warm, aromatic, and massive in portion.   I ordered the Chicken Tikka Masala, the Garlic Naan, Steamed Rice, and the Aloo Tikki (Must be a minimum of $25.00 to order for delivery). Everything was packed clean and tight, no spills and no issues.   The Chicken Tikka Masala is one of their most popular menu options. Now I know why. Creamy, smooth, rich, and especially spicy (if you order it as such). A perfect consistency with large chunks of delicious chicken. The tomato is not overwhelming, the spices don't rule the flavor (saffron is especially nice), and the chicken has a great consistency. I ordered a side of steamed rice, which was incredible for the amount given at $3.00. I expected a tiny bowl, but instead received an entire 6 x 6 to-go box full.   The Garlic Naan is good. The flavor is not especially strong, it's incredibly soft, not insanely chewy, but chewy enough; great to have just alone as a snack. The portion is large enough to be split between three people or more, and the texture is fluffy with that infamous smoothness of naan. I would honestly prefer regular naan, but that doesn't mean the garlic isn't especially tasty.  The Aloo Tikki numbers in two for $3.00, both about the circumference of a tennis ball. They are thick potatoes cakes, with a smooth interior and an especially crispy exterior. A little on the heavy side, but still delicious. They come with two sauces, one of which is a very close relative of a green avocado salsa, and the other a thick, sweet brown sauce. I have no idea what they are. I prefer them mixed together, because the green is especially spicy and the brown is a little too sweet. Combining or dual dipping evens them out perfectly.  Overall, the meal impressed me. I'm full with so many leftovers for tonight. Everything was absolutely wonderful and the delivery was so quick and efficient. I feel horrible, by the way. I ordered delivery and gave the girl the wrong amount for a tip. I wanted to give her $6.00 instead of $3.00. *Sigh*

Reviews.Author: Wenwen
Reviews.Content: OMG Yelpers - thanks so much for your recommendations - we were in Vegas for the weekend and didn't want to eat on the Strip. We drove out to this place for dinner because of all of the Yelp reviews and it was fantastic. Everything was delicious and authentic (and spicy!) and the service was great too. We cannot wait to come back - yay!

Reviews.Author: Nadine
Reviews.Content: The food was great!   Tomato soup, garlic naan, tandoori chicken, Karachi chicken.  However as great as the staff was last time, this time not so much.  Mostly attentive, just chaotic.   Also the decor could use lots of help.

Reviews.Author: Farhad
Reviews.Content: Great food! First time coming here and the owner greeted us at the door and made us feel very comfortable. Great variety and the price was on point! Would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Author: Jeffrey
Reviews.Content: Best Indian Lunch Buffet in Las Vegas!  This place has been open for about a year, but as you can see has already received accolades from over 200 Yelpers. I was introduced to this restaurant by my Indian friend who assured me it was the best in town. For $10.99 (or for that matter at any price) this lunch buffet is outstanding. It has a 35 display of savory meats and vegetables from traditional tandoori chicken to a goat stew. Admittedly, passed on the goat, but everything else was great, including the desserts. A complimentary freshly-baked nan (garlic or plain) comes with each order.  Spacious and clean and an A Health Department rating completes the offering.

Reviews.Author: tricia
Reviews.Content: I've been to several Indian restaurants here in Vegas and this one is definitely the best I've had. The garlic naan is chewy and delicious. Also, so many great vegetarian choices on the lunch buffet which is a very reasonable $9.99. The staff is extremely sweet and they provide great service!

Reviews.Author: Amir
Reviews.Content: Recently dined here for the lunch buffet hoping to find the best Indian food in Vegas. Greatly disappointed. Being originally from the Bay Area, I've ate at some really fantastic Indian/Pakistani restaurants. Haven't found one in vegas yet.   The staff was very friendly and the Garlic Naan was really good. However, allot of the food tasted bland and lacked flavor altogether. The chicken curry lacked chicken and the flavor of the yogurt was overwhelming. The Saag, Samosa's and the Dal lacked flavor. The pakoras tasted stale and the rice in the Biryani was over cooked.   The only two things good were the Garlic Naan and the desert, Galub Jamun. I see all the great reviews so maybe I just came on a day when the cook wasn't feeling it.

Reviews.Author: Michael
Reviews.Content: Delhi Indian Cuisine has been on my radar for quite some time. I've seen the high reviews and wanted to check this place out. I'm so glad that I did because the food here rocks! (my socks).  The lunch buffet starts at 11:00am and goes until 3:00pm. It is one of the better priced Indian buffets in town at 9.99. I came in and ordered the lunch buffet. The dining room is very clean and spacious. There is a large buffet area which is loaded with tons of food.  The yelp check in offer was for either a soda or one of their house made lassi's, basically, a yogurt smoothie. They have a sweet one, a salty one, and a mango one. I ordered the mango. It was SOOO good. The flavor was very mango-ey and it was silky smooth and had a nice mouthfeel from the yogurt.  As for the food, I would recommend anything! I especially liked their chicken, all of their versions of them were super tender. The goat stew was especially tasty as well. It wasn't too gamey and the sauce on it was fabulous! There wasn't anything on the menu that I didn't like.  One thing that I thought was kinda weak was their garlic naan. I found the taste to be a little bit bland. And for their noodle, milk dessert was a little bit too sweet.  Service was also kinda questionable. They seemed to start out pretty slow with taking our orders and getting our drinks, and after our first round of dishes they didn't clear our plates fast enough so that we were stacking our plates on top of each other. But, they were quicker at bussing our table during the middle of our dining experience.  Would I come back? Oh, you know it, because I loves me some Indian food. And the food here is delicious, fresh, and tasty. And try the mango lassi, it's really good.

Reviews.Author: Kart
Reviews.Content: Quantity over quality is best way to describe this location. It also doesn't help that during their buffet hours they rented out half the restaurant to a family that was celebrating their wedding party. This isn't the most professional thing to do, because things did get a bit hectic when you try to get food at the serving stations.   Now to the quality of the food. The curry flavor is so-so, lot of the curries are watery. The naan was excellent, but the food can use some improvement.   I'd recommend Mint, Saffron, or Mount Everest over this place. Check them out for their buffet and a-la carte meals.

Reviews.Author: Justin
Reviews.Content: This is seriously the tastiest, most legit Indian buffet my wife and I had been to since Manohar's Dehli Palace in Los Angeles. Would recommend this to anyone who likes good Indian food. It's not exactly as authentic as some places we've been to (Taj Mahal in Boise), but it's spicier and more authentic than most white boy / gringo style Indian buffets in the U.S.  EAT CURRIES AND SUCH TO ONE DAY BECOME INDIAN FOOD YOURSELF!!!

Reviews.Author: Ev
Reviews.Content: Very very good! Had a great first experience. Everything we ordered was hot, full of flavor with the perfect amount of spice. We were here during dinner and had great service. Will definitely be back soon!

Reviews.Author: Miguel
Reviews.Content: Made reservations on this yelp page- yet wasn't allowed to come in because they were only   open to CES  people... Ruined my companion bday dinner   Dude at the door was rude as hell

Reviews.Author: Shashank
Reviews.Content: I would Rate this restaurant top notch.. Awesome food, great service, beautiful interiors with an awesome pic of Himalayas. Not far away from strip. They even added rice when we packed the leftovers. I forgot o take pic if anyone can post that to me.

Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: Terrific location. Very attentive wait staff that were on their game. We had multiple waiters check in actively. Food was very good as well.

Reviews.Author: Jason
Reviews.Content: Came in for lunch buffet. Great variety. All delicious. The vegetable samosas were my favorite. Crust was light and crispy filling was moist. I've had samosas elsewhere that were doughy and dry. The goat curry is definitely worth a try. They come in big chunks, lean and tender.

Reviews.Author: Ranjith
Reviews.Content: We have placed few orders, the way of packing is not good the entire food got leacked into the packing bag and we have informed to them, the restaurant staff members are very bad in the way of receiving the customer calls were not so improper and the way of talking to the customer is not good, we asked them to refund my money they didn't do that and they haven't replaced my order, fuck the restaurant

Reviews.Author: Food
Reviews.Content: I have tried many Indian restaurants but this place stands out all their food was very flavourful and fresh we had been here for lunch buffet . This place is must go place if you are in Vegas it satisfies both south and north Indian cuisines.

Reviews.Author: Jared
Reviews.Content: Does Delhi Indian Cuisine serve the best Indian food I've tried?  Sadly no.  Do they serve the worst I've tried?  Far from it.  Simply put, Delhi Indian Cuisine is average if not slightly above.  I went with a group of Yelpers for a Sunday lunch buffet.  I was impressed by the overall number of dishes to try and found the $10.99 price to be quite fair.  Not being one to shy away from new foods, I tried a sampling of nearly all the options Delhi has to offer from meat dishes to vegetarian.  I even tried the curried goat, a protein new to me.  It wasn't bad but there was nothing about it that made me think  oh my goodness, this is awesome.  In fact, that is true for basically everything I tried.  There was nothing that I wanted to push aside but there was also nothing I wanted to go back up to serve up seconds of.  I had their chicken makhani and chicken tikka masala which are typically my favorites at an Indian restaurant.  Both were good just not spectacular.  My biggest disappointment was the saag paneer.  I got a nice healthy scoop of saag but had trouble finding the paneer.  Its a good thing I like creamed spinach because that is about all it was.  At least on my plate.  I did see others with paneer on their plates so maybe I just got the bottom of the barrel before it was refilled.  At the other end of the buffet bar, I did like the desserts quite a lot.  I tried and thoroughly enjoyed the galub jamun and the syrup those little dough balls are in.  There was a rice porridge or pudding of sorts that was tasty too.  Sweet, cool and refreshing on a balmy summers afternoon.  In the end, the food was fine but the company was better.

Reviews.Author: Kris
Reviews.Content: We had the lunch buffet. It is a great way to try lots of things. They brought us fresh naan and garlic naan. It was fresh and delicious. There were lots of meat and vegetarian dishes. It was a bargain for at 11.99 a person.

Reviews.Author: Kaiv
Reviews.Content: Didnt enjoyed the food as it was not good based on price... i just tried having seeing the good rating..

Reviews.Author: Vishal
Reviews.Content: Great food and excellent customer service.  We went there almost around closing time, most of the restaurants will probably say their kitchens are closed but they accommodated us without any rush.  Food quality was great, specifically garlic roti, onion Kulcha and baigan bhadatha.

Reviews.Author: Cynthia
Reviews.Content: Mmmmm I love Indian buffets!! Very clean inside, attentive and friendly staff. Used to be a super salad back in the day...we've visited twice so far both for their lunch buffet, and sat where we used to sit way back then :) Can't beat the price when you are craving big plates of spiced comfort food.They have a nice vegetarian selection as noted by other yelpers which my daughter likes and good garlic nann. They also have an assortment of fresh fruits and a small salad area with some chutneys and desserts. Definitely my daughter's favorite which means we'll be back.

Reviews.Author: Laraine
Reviews.Content: Fantastic! We went to the lunch buffet and they have the largest selection of dishes for vegetarians like us, (don't worry there were plenty of meat options for you carnivorous types.)  And the customer service was out of this world! We felt like we got the royal treatment, we had a couple special requests and were accommodated graciously, I have to say this may be our new favorite indian restaurant in Las Vegas!

Reviews.Author: Trent
Reviews.Content: Had an Indian person in town for the first time so we tried a few different restaurants courtesy of yelp and by far this place was the best. On top of it, service was outstanding even though it was just the lunch buffet. The workers clearly take pride in their restaurant.

Reviews.Author: Christina
Reviews.Content: FINALLY found some good Indian food in this city! This will be our go to place for Indian food from now on. The lunch buffet was so delicious and most importantly FRESH! The atmosphere was nice and clean. The staff was very polite. The restaurant is chef owned and you can tell that he takes pride in his food and restaurant.

Reviews.Author: Saravanan
Reviews.Content: It'll be a sin to steal a star from Delhi Indian Cuisine, they come to be party with the most delicious food and an all star buffet backed by a very friendly host. Oh, did I tell you about the tall glass full of real mango lassi that's free of psychological pricing at three dollars?  If you want north Indian food while on the strip, don't waste a moment before you decide to drive to Delhi Indian Cuisine.

Reviews.Author: Jade
Reviews.Content: As much as I enjoy trying new things, there are certain cuisine I am a creature of habit. I have my favorite spot for that food and I am just not messing with it. Indian lunch buffet is one such thing, but after hearing some love from trusted friends, I reluctantly shook up our routine and tried out this new spot.   It's a large open room so it's probably a better bet if you are dining with a large group as the other better buffets are rather small dining rooms. Size of the buffet is fairly good as there were 16 hot dishes, some chutney, lettuce, cucumbers, some fruit and kheer.   We got the garlic naan, which I thought was superb and had nice garlicky flavor.   All the food was solid, but there were a few standout dishes for me. Tandoori chicken was juicy and I appreciate these aren't huge hormone large pieces. The goat curry had a nice flavor in the sauce, though quite a bit of bones to navigate., Saag paneer was solid, a bit creamier than average. The one surprise for me is the malai kofta. In the past, I've disliked this dish at other places, but I loved it here because of the texture of the kofta. I find some places it just is dry and dough-y and full of blah, but the texture of this is soft and creamy even. There wasn't a label for it, but it was sort've cut up pieces of sausage similar to a lulu kebab that had a nice gingerly flavor to it that was awesome wrapped in naan with chutney. The yellow daal was really tasty - probably my favorite one I've had in the recent years.   I see that there are pics of the Himalayas and seen some mention of there being Nepalese owners and Indian owners so it's reflected in the way food is flavored. I find Napalese is less spicy and more a balance with savory and sweet.   Service was decent. We had our drinks refilled and the people were friendly. There's a current check in for a lassi or soda so we took advantage and got a free mango lassi which was yummy.   I think this matches my usual standby in quality so I'm glad we went. I think I will alternate between this place and Mint depending on the type of Indian I feel like having.

Reviews.Author: Nancy
Reviews.Content: Awesome food choices . the spice level was good as well . Very neat and clean . very helpfull staff . The Gajjar halwa and kheer were simply amazing .  we went for buffet they had good choices for both veg and non veg  and a lot of items for both. garlic naan and chowmein were also very very good. i would definetly recommend them to all my friends and family visting Vegas .

Reviews.Author: Melissa
Reviews.Content: As soon as you walk in you know you came to the right place. Full buffet and beautiful ambiance. Mango lassi was bomb!

Reviews.Author: amy
Reviews.Content: I tried a lots of indian buffet in CA. This Indian Have the most varieties. The goat curry and chicken curry are my favorite! And the buffet is worth your money.  The service is excellent, Ashmita always come and ask if me and my friends need any thing and add water for US.

Reviews.Author: Norm
Reviews.Content: I wanted to try this lunch buffet since reading some friends' reviews and I went today.  It's taken the #1 spot in the Indian lunch buffet spot with one restaurant yet to go.  I was there early, about 11;15, and I was the first person in the restaurant.   There soon were several other customers.  It's a very large room with lots of tables laid out well and the buffet is a large area opposite the entrance.  With a check in on Yelp, you get either a mango lassi or a soda free.  It's a good deal for merely checking in.  I ordered garlic naan and then headed to the buffet.  The naan was good but I wish it had more of a garlic flavor.  For the first plate, I had chicken Biryani, a couple vegetable pakoras, a vegetable samosa, a piece of tandoori chicken, some chili chicken, soya badi, and some saag paneer.  Everything I had was very good and I noticed that almost all dishes had a spiciness that I liked.  Of these, the weakest dishes was the saag paneer.  The crust of the samosa was flaky and the filling was very good.  The soya badi was quite good.  For my second plate, I had squash, Navratan korma, chicken curry, and chana masala.  All of these were very good save the squash which was a little nondescript.  I also tried some of their raita which was good.  The chicken curry didn't have very much of a curry flavor but when the juices from the chana masala mixed with the curry juice, it became much better.  Finally, I went back and got one idli and put a small amount of tamarind chutney on it.  It had a soft texture and was good.  I was a but disappointed that they had no dhokla.  I had read Christopher S.' review and I was interested in trying something different.  Overall, this is a very solid buffet and moves to the top tier of Indian restaurants.  The price is now $10.99 but that's still very good considering the wide choice you have with their large buffet.  Service was very good!  Several times, someone stopped by to see how things were.  A woman stopped once and asked me if it was too spicy so they know that they spice their foods.  Plates were cleared before I came back each time.  This is another stop for after hiking when we go to an Indian buffet.  It's a great addition to the Indoian dining in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Author: Sunita
Reviews.Content: Waitress rude and stuck up. Didn't honor Yelp offer of free mango lassi upon Yelp check in. Food tasted good and no complains there. Taste wasn't anything special or remarkable.

Reviews.Author: Sudha
Reviews.Content: Finally an Indian buffet I can go to. Wide spread..lot of choices both in vegetarian as well as non vegetarian food......clean ambience, good service, decent price.

Reviews.Author: Arthur
Reviews.Content: **Summary**        - Value - This is probably the cheapest Indian buffet in town.        - Quality - This ranks as one of the top Indian buffets I've had. Moist chicken/goat and good curry. What more can you ask for?        - Service - They're absent from the front a lot of times, but when they do come over, they're very friendly.        - Asian Influence - They have chow mein and chili chicken. I guess it adds variety, lol. **Price**        - Lunch Buffet $9.99 **Ordered**        - Garlic Naan - I suggest requesting the garlic naan or they might give you the regular naan instead.        - Tandori Chicken - Flavorful as ever cooked in a clay oven.        - Chili Chicken - One of their Asian tasting entrees. It wasn't too spicy. A little salty from the sauce, but good otherwise.        - Chicken Makhani - Chicken + Curry + Butter = Delicious. The chicken wasn't too dry and the curry was as buttery delicious as ever.        - Chicken Saag - I prefer the makhani, but this adds variety to my plate.        - Goat Curry - The goat is fall off the bone tender. A must try. **Recommendations**        - I'd recommend this place if you're looking for a nice lunch Indian buffet. It's a great deal!

Reviews.Author: Julia
Reviews.Content: Best Indian I've had in the USA!  The sauces (especially the Mali Kafta) were amaaaazing!!! Naan and rice (cumin seasoned) were delish too. The servers were attentive and so friendly. *we came for dinner but we hear lunch buffet is a hit!*

Reviews.Author: Hitesh
Reviews.Content: Amazing food. Amazing service. This is real indian food. Every item's taste is so perfect and balanced. This is second time I came here coming from San Francisco. I wish they open in Bay area as well. Their Naan is one of the best I ever had.

Reviews.Author: Ujwol
Reviews.Content: Satisfied with lunch today. There buffet is one of the best buffet I have ever ate. Loved it. I will always eat here when I do Vegas trip. Recommended to all

Reviews.Author: Jenny Dale
Reviews.Content: My first  time  here...I missed  the lunch buffet  which  starts  at 11-3pm but I  will surely come back. The service  was awesome!  The food was really  good...

Reviews.Author: Lani
Reviews.Content: A great value Indian cuisine buffet. We arrived right when they opened on a Thursday. We were sat at a booth and it obviously was not crowded at all. Many patrons who were already seated were of Indian descent which is always a good indicator of authenticity. There were also a few locals. Our server came along a few minutes later and we ordered naan bread and a mango lassi and went to work on the buffet.   I loved the curry selection and they had a variety of typical Indian cuisine meats such as goat and lamb as well as chicken. Tandoori was spot on and the only thing I didn't care for was the spinach. At the end of the line there was a variety of soups and some dessert and fruit selections which were delicious! My favorite was the semiya payasam which was creamy and thick with noodles in a milky soup. The mango lassi order took some time to come out since it was forgotten the first time but it did come out right in time for desert which was fine. Overall price for the buffet was well-worth it for two people under $30! Definitely would come back!

Reviews.Author: Rahil
Reviews.Content: Came here for the breakfast, they have one of the best buffet in Vegas. Many choices in Buffet and delicious food.

Reviews.Author: Shakir
Reviews.Content: Good food amazing gulabjamoon clean and neat restaurant with good customer service what else do you want. Will come back again

Reviews.Author: Food
Reviews.Content: Great place great food !!! Amazing mango lassie Must check out ... Best out of 2 buffet that i been to Owner super nice guy , great garlic nan

Reviews.Author: Jaswinder
Reviews.Content: Excellent food! We had a class reunion and ordered food for 18 guys. Everyone love it. Good service.

Reviews.Author: Tracey
Reviews.Content: My foodie fantasy day two, another 5-star success. I couldn't bring myself to go to a casino restaurant after the long day standing at the World Market Gift Show. So, thank you Yelp for another great find.   I found Las Vegas' Best Indian Food! No, REALLY they won 2015 Best Indian Food by the Las Vegas Review Journal. Delhi is a very large family restaurant and everyone made sure that everything was perfect. Even a little hiccup was corrected immediately.   I had the Vegetable Thali for dinner. Ample portion and I couldn't resist the Pani Puri to start. The Chai Tea was rich and creamy. Delhi has earned a place on my Vegas Restaurant list.

Reviews.Author: Zak
Reviews.Content: Biryani was great ! was here for a conference and tried this restaurant and it was worth.

Reviews.Author: Cathy
Reviews.Content: We went here for late dinner. So, this place was pretty empty. Other than our server not giving us personal space, the service was good.   We tried a few of our favorites. For the most part, we enjoyed dinner.  Mango Lassi: The color was a bit off-putting. It was very orange. It didn't quite taste like what I've had at other Indian restaurants. This tasted artificial. 2/5  Papadum: Perfect cracker. But what makes this exceptionally good were the sauces: tamarind and mint. Their sauces are better than anyone else's. 5/5  Garlic Naan: This is my favorite. I can eat this stuff by itself. Warm, soft, buttery and garlicky goodness. I'm making myself want garlic naan by what I just said. 5/5  Prawn Korma: The sauce was a bit garlicky and creamy. It has some spicy kick to it. I wish this dish had more prawns since it is in fact PRAWN korma. 4/5

Reviews.Author: Nitin
Reviews.Content: You have 4.5 star rating in Yelp. I am sure it is influenced by the ala carte because most of the starters in buffet today were like warm, tight. A bit stale.  You have a good customer base. Please strive to be great every day.   Will hit the main course now with expectations !

Reviews.Author: A.
Reviews.Content: Food was GREAT!!!!   I only docked 2 stars since service was pretty much non-existent. We went in on a Friday afternoon for the lunch buffet, it was a slow day I suppose, there were probably only 6 other patrons eating there. After you are seated and given your drink and naan, you are pretty pretty much on your own until its time to pay. If you ever want a drink or naan refill during the rest of your meal, you'll have to get up and go look for your server in the backroom/kitchen. I had to do this twice. Its like they don't care about your refills if its a slow day and instead just go hang out in the backroom.

Reviews.Author: Bernadette
Reviews.Content: Hands down the best Indian restaurant I've ever been to. The lunch buffet is cheap and the quality and taste of the food is amazing!  The staff was very attentive by keeping our glasses full and giving us as much naan as we wanted. The garlic naan is delicious and they have a bunch of vegetarian options. My boyfriend eats meat and he was surprised with how many meat options they had as well. I'm so happy I tried  this place, it's soooo good!

Reviews.Author: Geo
Reviews.Content: Great place the food was amazing and so was the service I will be definitely coming back here and bring all my friends !!!!

Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: Norm K invited a bunch of Yelpers to eat here for the lunch buffet. I wasn't expecting my taste buds to be delighted at almost every bite or for everything here to taste good and fresh, but that's pretty much what I got.  You know the rule of thumb about places that largely serve their own demographic, right? Well, I got really excited when I walked in and saw tables and tables full of Indian customers. It's such a huge place that I'd almost call it a dining hall rather than a dining room, and there were plenty of tables available for our group. Wish the lighting wasn't so dim, but that's a minor issue.  Naan, either standard or garlic depending on what you ask for (I think the garlic actually gets too soggy, but table majority ruled), is brought out by servers as needed. The rest of the food and condiments are in the buffet line. Starting from the front of the line, you run meats, veggies, and sauces/desserts. I'll just list what I had:  - Tandoori chicken: the one without sauce; luckily, only a little dry as opposed to the considerably or ridiculously dry fare at other places. - Chili chicken: reminiscent of some Chinese fried chicken offerings, but pretty sweet, not too spicy, and definitely fresh as opposed to what you might expect at an Asian buffet. - Chicken curry: can't recall the flavor exactly, but I'm sure it was good. - Chicken makhani: aka butter chicken, definitely a favorite of mine at Indian restaurants. Rich and delicious here as well. - Goat curry: tasty, somewhat fatty, typical gaminess of goat meat. Delicious. - Chicken biryani: chicken and rice dish, kinda sour but still not noticeably dry. - Vegetable pakora: a fried vegetable dish, wasn't very special but could pair with something like the saag paneer - Vegetable samosa: fried pastry stuffed with potato, good filling to crust ratio, crunchy on the outside and warm on the inside, not too spicy if at all spicy - Saag paneer: creamy spinach with cheese. Didn't even pick up cheese until round 2, so I was pleasantly surprised. Tastes good until you get really full.  Hey ma, I ate my veggies!  - Navratan korma: curry with cheese and potato, or at least those were the only two I fished out of the buffet tray. Pretty tasty, worth it even for meat-eaters like myself. - Tamarind sauce: sweet sauce that you can dip naan in. Helped to combat the sour taste when I accidentally bit into something unpalatably sour from the chicken biryani. - Mint sauce: light, and as minty as you would reasonably expect. I didn't really try pairing this with as many of the dishes as I should have, but I'm sure it would complement something well. - Gutab jamun: I probably have had this before, but I'll be darned if any place has made it this good. Great warm dessert dumpling in a sweet sauce. Wish I'd had room for more! - Kheer: rice pudding available next to the fruit, mildly sweet and probably should be eaten before you overwhelm your mouth with gulab jamun  I haven't gone out of my way to try every Indian restaurant around my hometown of San Jose or around the Vegas area, but Delhi Indian Cuisine serves through and through the best Indian food that I've had so far, period. The buffet thing is icing on the cake as it hardly detracted from the quality and was a tremendous value at $11. Fair warning, though: it was a busy Sunday lunch, and I don't know if the weekday holds up. Go as early as you can for freshness, perhaps?

Reviews.Author: Brenda
Reviews.Content: This restaurant was excellent. Every dish we ordered was delicious. Heat being graded from 1-10 the spices were perfect. We all ordered different heat levels. The waiter was very informative with all questions answered. Will definitely return to try other dishes.

Reviews.Author: Vasundhara
Reviews.Content: Really good Indian food in Vegas. Chicken biriyani was excellent and garlic naan is a must try!!

Reviews.Author: Vianey
Reviews.Content: The paneer pakora appetizer is really yummy! They give fair portions for the price. Something else that I love about this is that they don't skimp on paneer! I ordered the shahi panner and it had good flavor, more vegetable than I'm used to but still good.

Reviews.Author: Krishna
Reviews.Content: ****STAY OUT OF THIS PLACE**** Pathetic food. The breads were totally unbaked and the food served was cold.  Extremely long wait times for serving a couple of thali.  Customer service is pretty bad and doesn't bother about your concern.  Overall please don't go by the misleading 4.5+ reviews

Reviews.Author: Pooran
Reviews.Content: Wow..... i am still drooling over the delicious indian food... must must try the chicken biryani  and the mango lassi... the place is comfortably seated but the food is to die for... oh and have the samosas   owner was very nice wanted to make sure my fam and friends enjoyed the food... yes we did and will always stop here on our every trip to vegas....

Reviews.Author: Ramesh
Reviews.Content: I went to the this place for lunch with my wife and my son . When I went there , I was really surprised with the decoration inside . And the buffet wow, it's the largest Indian buffet in Las Vegas so far ,, so many varieties in the buffet , they have the largest selection of vegetarian and non- veg items , and the price wow, ,, just under $10 . Waiter and servers are so friendly and polite ,, great customer service ,, I am really glad conning here ,, highly recommended ,, Great service !!! Great Food , definitely going back soon .

Reviews.Author: Nilesh
Reviews.Content: tasty spicy veg biriyani and authentic chiken currry . both the items were delicious. satisfied with the taste. THE INDIAN TASTE in Vegas.Do visit

Reviews.Author: Regina
Reviews.Content: Service: 5 Stars  Food: 5 Stars (well, I really like the goat curry, garlic naan, Khir...) Ambience: 5 Stars  Yelp check in: free lassi/soda  What more can I say?  Just try it for yourself!

Reviews.Author: Judy
Reviews.Content: For $10.99 lunch buffet, it's a great place during working hours. Easy to find location and very clean. Food quality is good. Spicy level is bearable. My favorite is the chicken curry. The chicken is very soft to taste. A variety of selections. Would go back!

Reviews.Author: Dawn
Reviews.Content: I kinda get what another reviewer meant when she said the buffet is quite large, yet lacked variety. Everything was pretty great though; I love that they aren't as afraid of adding a little bit of heat to their buffet dishes (most places avoid heat in buffet items, for obvious reasons).   I also thought the garlic naan was wonderful, hot and fresh from the kitchen. They brought it out pretty late into our meal, which brings me to the service. Not bad, but a little slow. Understandable, as they haven't been open long, and not a huge deal. Just looks like they might still be working out a couple of kinks perhaps?  I would definitely return, for the buffet, and possibly for dinner if the mood strikes.

Reviews.Author: Charles
Reviews.Content: Not too far from vegas strip. The lunch special is a great deal! Best food I ate while in vegas! Get the chicken tikka masala over white rice!! So good :) also very nice staff.

Reviews.Author: Sal
Reviews.Content: OMG. Both the food, and service was excellent. Very kind Gentleman named Hari defined various dishes for us, and went out of his way to make sure we were taken care of. The Chicken Tikki Masala was so very tasty, along with garlic naan bread. Very clean place!!!!!!! Thanks Hari, you rock!!!!!

Reviews.Author: Arun Kumar
Reviews.Content: The best Indian restaurant in Vegas. They had idli and sambar which was the best. Chicken biryani and samosa was good too. It was spacious and the waiters were also courteous.

Reviews.Author: Parag
Reviews.Content: I am a picky eater when it comes to Indian food and I have been disappointed by the quality of some of the Indian food I have eaten over various major cities in the US. But this restaurant has one of the best Indian buffets in the US (from those I have been to). It is cheap, has a big capacity for seating, and a good variety of starters, vegetables, meat, and rice dishes. The goat meat dishes are excellent cause the meat is soft and tender (as compared to chewy meat with lot of bones in some other places). Chicken biryani is standard and not too spicy. I loved their samosas as well. I have heard that they have good lassi, though I haven't tasted it yet. This places is usually full of Indian tourists over weekend, so you may need to come a bit early (between 11 am-noon).

Reviews.Author: Ahmed
Reviews.Content: Very good food, the garlic naan bread is quite nice. Butter chicken always is my favorate.

Reviews.Author: Simone
Reviews.Content: I have been here twice and each time the staff was wonderful, and the food was amazing too. I am a huge fan of Indian food, so finding a buffet that served great quality food, at a beyond reasonable price had me sold. I highly recommend this place. The fresh Naan, that is made to order is delectable, along with the curried goat, and tikka masala was fully of flavor to compliment it all. Although the buffet has only a few choice, there wasn't any lack of flavor or quality to each choice. There is only one thing i would like change and that would be there being more light in the building. I personally like to see what i'm eating and it is awfully dim in there. Besides that, Yelpers please check this place out! It is worth your time, and belly happiness!

Reviews.Author: Sammy
Reviews.Content: Ok so I like to try many indian restaurants when I go on vacation...and this is awesome! Felt like home cooking....Sunday brunch....must go if you are visiting from out of town....cheaper than a regular buffet.

Reviews.Author: K
Reviews.Content: Good ambience and good food. The owner was very nice and so was the staff we reached there at 10:30 and they did not rush us at over all a good place to eat Indian food

Reviews.Author: Jinesh
Reviews.Content: owned by a nepali, but serves authentic indian food. The service was slow even though we were the only ones in the restaurant on a Fri night. The location is a bit far from the strip, but worth the trip.

Reviews.Author: Revanth
Reviews.Content: Very bad chicken fried rice ... had no spring onions ... just plain rice and chicken nothing else ... very disappointed with the food. After seeing those many reviews I don't think it's worth that many reviews

Reviews.Author: CK
Reviews.Content: The food is excellent. The service, one of the best I have seen at any Indian Restaurant's.  Their Biryani is very tasty, the pa Kora s - perfectly sprinkled with tiny salty spices and the mood music was superlative too. Love this place.

Reviews.Author: Debi
Reviews.Content: Oh man, where do I start?  My husband and I eat a whole grain plant-based diet, and Indian food has lots to offer.  We ordered one of almost everything on the Vegan menu, except for naan and roti.  We're full and satisfied, and have enough for at least one more meal!  Delicious flavors, savory aromas...what more could one ask for?  It's no surprise they were awarded Best Restaurant 2015.

Reviews.Author: Debi
Reviews.Content: Very good, nice buffet available daily.  Garlic Naan, served with buffet. Amazing Lentils,, Curry dishes, plenty of vegetarian dishes........ Manager and wait staff very friendly, interested in customer satisfaction. Very pleased! Excellent quality, and experience.

Reviews.Author: Ken
Reviews.Content: Awesome and affordable food, good service and family friendly . What else u need? I will come again to try other entrees . They have 9.99 buffet with endless choices .

Reviews.Author: Prasad
Reviews.Content: This place has opened two months ago and hence doesn't appear on google maps. But dont let that get into your way for this awesome north indian treat. I like the owner n staff who are very polite and attentive to their customers. The food is of high quality and is priced reasonably. My pick would be the traditional style chicken curry and would recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Author: Madina
Reviews.Content: Two stars only on the strength of the food.   Second time here. First time was great good food and decent service.   Today is a different story. 1pm lunch buffet time and theres not too many people here the wait service is bad. Waited 25 min for our naan.   Our server went on break without telling us or notifying another waiter to watch our table. Did not get one refill of water.   Found three pieces of hair in the tikka masala   Although very good masala after the third hair I just couldn't eat anymore.   One of the hairs looked like an eyebrow hair.   The manager was nice about it and gave us the meals for free even after we tried to pay for at least 1.

Reviews.Author: Ramen
Reviews.Content: I don't invest my time in reviewing places that don't shine for me, but rare weird experiences ask of Yelp-catharsis. If you're considering visiting this place, please note that all recent reviews have a trend: poor ratings by reviewers who are most likely connected to the Indian subcontinent; high ratings by others. If you are still coming, then keep your guest service expectations as low as possible. Because of the location and constant flow of touristy customers (who won't return in a hurry irrespective of their experience here), the management seems to care not much for customer service. Sorry folks, this is one atypical case where the Yelp rating is farcically misleading on many fronts. Would I visit this place again? Nope, not even if someone else is willing to pay for my meal.

Reviews.Author: Yuzo
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed this buffet! Lots of selections, large parking lot, friendly service! When I went, they didn't serve any dishes with paneer but hopefully next time I visit again, they'll have it! Great flavor and consistency with all their selections.

Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: This place is good - it bills itself as  The Largest Indian Buffet in Las Vegas.  It has about two or three steam trays/food serving stations, and it's all typical Indian buffet stuff - well-done tandoori chicken, chicken tikka masala, goat curry, biryani (I believe it was chicken), basmati rice, salad, and typical desserts - cut-up fruit, kheer, etc. It's reasonably priced (about $11 or $12) and well worth eating at if you're visiting the nearby Museum of Atomic Testing, or shopping at the Best Buy, Target, Men's Wearhouse, etc. while taking a break from the Strip.  There are also no gambling machines, so that's also a nice break from the Strip. I've eaten here three or four times, and will definitely continue to eat here when I'm in town.

Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: Best Indian buffet I've ever had.  10 min drive from the strip near UNLV.  Big lunch buffet selection including meat dishes.  Everything was good and only $11 for lunch.   My favorites: goat curry and chicken biryani.  Goat curry had lots of sauce was good for dipping the garlic naan.  Naan was fresh from the oven and doughy (a bit too doughy).  Indian buffets usually have little spice to cater to the masses, but not Delhi.  Actually had good flavor and decent spice level.   Get the mango lassi too.  You won't be disappointed.  5 stars overall.

Reviews.Author: thin
Reviews.Content: This is my Indian place to go in Las Vegas. They have really good varieties and everything tasted good.  My favorite is goat curry and tandoori chicken. Their naan is very fluffy and awesome. Mango lassi is great as well. Servers are friendly and attentive. Overall, it's worth the money that you spent for an Indian buffet.

Reviews.Author: Anurag
Reviews.Content: Excellent in everything !  Food tastes amazing Veg food, non veg food, service quality taste best !

Reviews.Author: Ite
Reviews.Content: No complaints. All love and appreciation for delicious food and awesome service. I'll be back for sure!

Reviews.Author: Ariel
Reviews.Content: Whoo I'm kind of a fan!!! I would have definitely given 4 stars for food and cleanliness, however there was a little something the servers did that I'm sure would annoy most people, but I'll get to that later. When we first came in, there were about 4 other parties seated. There was a lot of seating available and everything was kept nice and clean. We didn't get any menus, once we sat down, she told us we could start on the buffet. We didn't realize they were only offering a buffet for lunch but no problem. She also asked if we wanted fresh garlic or regular naan and if we wanted mango lassi. We went with garlic naan and skipped on the lassi just because we wanted to see how the food was first.  We basically tried all the meat options and many of the vegetarian options and there wasn't a single dish we didn't like. They all had incredible flavor and you could tell everything was really fresh and constantly having the temperature checked. Forgive me, I forgot basically all the names as I just started getting into Indian cuisine, Sorry! But everything was delicious. Now time for that annoying little quirk they had. They started passing out fliers to everyone to vote for them as Best of Las Vegas while everyone was eating. Okay no problem, I told them I would later since I mean I was basically mid-bite lmao BUT they wouldn't leave our table till I was like okay fine and pulled it up on my phone. And they were telling me how to vote and apparently you need an account to vote, then she grabs my phone, clicks login and tells me to enter my Facebook. I don't have a Facebook. Soo then she takes my phone again and tells me to create an account and just stares at me waiting for me to do it. Are you kidding me?? Ughh so I enter my info and it says it sent me and email confirmation. I kept checking and I never got an email..finally I tell her I'll call her over when I get it. She continued to check on me the rest of the time we were there and when we checked out. -_- Ya I know, I could of said no, but I didn't want to be mean. They should of never been so aggressive with it anyways.  Overall, food was amazing especially for $23 total (including tax before tip) and water was constantly being filled. Also fresh garlic naan was definitely a plus but hopefully if we come back, they don't attack us with that crap again. If they don't, 4 stars.

Reviews.Author: Vivian
Reviews.Content: Is it just me or is curry more potent than Thanksgiving turkey? I feel like I need to drift off into a deep slumber every time I have some Indian food!  But I don't care. It's worth it.  I've only eaten here for the lunch buffet (about $11- cheaper than most Indian buffets I believe) and have enjoyed it every time. Choose between garlic/butter or just plain naan. Can't go wrong with either. Very flavorful dishes and vegetarian options. Only wish there were more! Usually only one choice for dessert. Employees also prompt and accommodating.

Reviews.Author: Arpit
Reviews.Content: Really really amazing food. Very authentic in terms of taste. If you are in Vegas  and love Indian food then it's a must visit. I am out of words to describe this place

Reviews.Author: Sam
Reviews.Content: The best Indian I've ever had in the states. Im from uk and Indian is a big dish so it takes a lot for me to say this. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Author: Mahesh
Reviews.Content: Awesome food....very well organized... More staff to help... I have tried all the Indian Restaurants in Las Vegas.. But this is my no 1. Choice..  I would recommend all who visit Las vegas please check this place out....  Delhi Palace ..

Reviews.Author: Jai
Reviews.Content: do not go here do not trust any ratings  we went for dinner and food was stale  decor and service was good  costed us $90. do not serve stale food to families who come for dinner and spend extra money.

Reviews.Author: T
Reviews.Content: Sat for 10 minutes- no menus, no drinks, no service.  Tried to seat us at someone else's table.  Won't be back.

Reviews.Author: April
Reviews.Content: Great food! Whenever i travel i automatically dont expect much from ethnic food in really touristy places, ie las vegas, but the food here was actually really good! I always judge my indian restaurants on their malai kofta and this place was right up there with my favorite places. Kudos and keep it up!

Reviews.Author: Samreen
Reviews.Content: The food is really yummy especially the tandoori chicken. It's very well cooked and their garlic naan is amazing! They also deliver which is a plus!

Reviews.Author: Ins
Reviews.Content: Huge selection of buffet items. Typical Indian buffet. I wouldn't say it's anything really great but I've also had worse so if this is an option and you're looking for reasonably priced buffet, I'd recommend.

Reviews.Author: Josh
