Reviews.Content: Fantastic as always. I decided to mostly eat the vegetarian dishes today. Saag paneer, chana masala, yellow dal. Mmmmm mmmm mmmm. It was fantastic. The veggie Palau rice was also incredible. My favorite buffet appetizer are the samosas and the bread as usual was fluffy and delicious. Today I tried their Chai Masala and was very impressed. Not overly sweet, but just enough sweetness to compliment the tea. Thanks Delhi!!!

Reviews.Author: Amanda
Reviews.Content: This restaurant is big and has a nicer setting than I thought it would. The owner Hari, comes from Tamba on the strip.   I was dining by myself so I went with the vegetable thali and mango lassi which is free if you check into yelp. My mango lassi was made in a blender at the bar so I could hear it being made from where I was sitting. The mango lassi was icy and tasted watered down. This was the first non creamy mango lassi I have had.   The samosa filling was well seasoned, not too greasy, but breading was a tad thick. It took 45 minutes for my vegetable thali to come. I am used to Indian restaurants being abnormally fast.   The presentation of the thali was classy and each dish tasted freshly made. My favorites were the malai kofta and the Kashmir sabji, the rest I could have done without. The malai kofta was well executed and the creaminess of the curry and aromatic spices worked harmoniously. First time I have had the Kashmir sabji and the assorted vegetables seasoned with herbs and spices pairs well with the richness of the malai kofta.    All the food I had was thoughtfully prepared and freshly made. Hari seems to genuinely care about his customers. After finding out i didn't like my mango lassi he made me another one without the ice. I hope they work on getting the food out in a more timely manner because I do not know anyone that wants to wait almost an hour for Indian food.

Reviews.Author: Brianna
Reviews.Content: I LOVE this place! I can't say enough! We went to Mount Everest indian buffet and it was entirely too spicy and I love spicy food! But this place is so perfect friendly and clean.

Reviews.Author: Nick
Reviews.Content: Possibly the best Indian spot I've ever been to. The Tandoori chicken was better than an Indian wedding I went to with and Indian caterer, and the non-veggie dhali was all around phenomenal.

Reviews.Author: Joanna
Reviews.Content: I am from out of state. My best friend and I were looking in the area to eat and decided to try out Dehli. Trying new food is always a risk. Dehli put that fear to rest. Hands down one of the best Indian cuisine buffets I've been to. Great service, great food, can it get better than that??? Would come back for sure!

Reviews.Author: Audra
Reviews.Content: We had come in from Los Angeles and we were so happy to find such an authentic Indian restaurant with food that excites your taste buds. Thank you for the wonderful sweets! :)

Reviews.Author: Tet
Reviews.Content: So far as I have experienced, the best Indian buffet in LV.  The staff is nice without being overbearing, and very attentive.  The food is always excellent.  I also like the fact that there is always a different item on the buffet which is veggie.

Reviews.Author: Johnny
Reviews.Content: Went for the lunch buffet, wide selection of chicken dishes, chicken tandoori, chili chicken, was quite appetizing, the curry chicken, not so.  The chicken curry seemed too watery to me.  The spices were off a little bit on the light side in all the dishes.   but overall, I liked it because of the large selection and the large dining area.  The AC was off so it was a bit muggy and uncomfortable.  Overall, based on the food alone, the taste is decent but not inspiring.  It's good because they put so much effort in it, but I don't think it's quite 4.5 stars.  I'd say closer to 3.5 to 4.

Reviews.Author: Kyle
Reviews.Content: This review is for the lunch buffet only. I have came to this place several times, and I return every time I get bored of bland everyday food, and I need spicy flavors with the kind of kick that jolts me out of my culinary boredom. For that effect I specially recommend the Chicken Makhani and Malai Kofta; I usually don't care much for the meat and just get the sauce and dip the Biryani garlic bread in it, then I frantically reach for my ice cold Coke (keep it close). The seasoned rice is also great. Warm atmosphere, friendly service, overall very good experience.

Reviews.Author: Marcio
Reviews.Content: By far the best Indian food in Las Vegas The service almost too good The food amazing The restaurant very clean The spicy very spicy The price very fair

Reviews.Author: Shahana
Reviews.Content: The Best Indian Buffet in town with a wide variety of dishes and very tasty food. Sure will recommend any one try and the staff is very polite with a big smile.

Reviews.Author: Phil
Reviews.Content: Very good buffet, at least twenty items to choose from, haven't eaten dinner there yet. Very friendly staff.

Reviews.Author: Kim
Reviews.Content: Lunch buffet was awesome! Very large selection of items, vegetarian and non-vegetarian alike.   Naan bread is brought to your table fresh from the oven, so no problem of dried out (or missing) naan in the buffet line like some other places. As if you need another reason to wolf down warm deliciousness...ask for the garlic naan, mmmmmm, you won't be sorry.  We ended our meal with one of my favorite things - a cup of real chai tea ($2/cup). If you have  never had it, you have to add your own sweetener, which is nice because you can adjust it to your liking (and you don't have to use real sugar if you prefer artificial sweeteners).  I would have to say this is one of the best Indian buffets I have had in Vegas. We left full and happy, without feeling heavy (other buffets we've visited often had overly oily items and this one did not). I also think that for the quality and selection of items, they could actually charge a couple dollars more and still be a bargain. We will definitely be back!  note to owners:  I wish you offered some kind of drink menu. Not only would customers would know what kind of drink options were available for purchase, it would also give your business the opportunity for additional revenue during the lunch buffet time.

Reviews.Author: Karan
Reviews.Content: So i am back here after 2 years!!!! The owner is still the same courteous person. Not all food were the same what I had it before. I had mango lassi too much yogurt and also the consistency was on the watery side. I had goat curry it was finger licking good. Butter chicken was nice & creamy but the flavor was bit on the pale side. Tandoori chicken was overcooked & dry. I loved palak paneer & gulab jamun so overall I would say it was not convincing as I was specially visiting for butter chicken.

Reviews.Author: Jennifer
Reviews.Content: I was very excited to get Indian food while in Vegas as Phoenix's Indian food scene.... how can I say this nicely.... leaves something to be desired. After seeing the great reviews, I knew we had to check Delhi out. We came for the lunch buffet on a weekday and it was not overly crowded (which was nice). The buffet was large with an extensive selection of dishes. Most of the food was quite good, with the spicy chicken curry being the tastiest option (in my opinion). They also had a large variety of vegetarian options if that is something you are looking for. I was a little disappointed that they didn't have chai tea on the buffet, nor did they have my favorite Indian dessert (the rice pudding... yum)... but apparently the selection changes from day to day, so maybe we came on an off day. The price is good for all that you get (about 11$). I must admit that I have had a better Indian buffet experience in Vegas (Evergreen... yum), but this is another great option, especially if you are a local. Happy eating, Vegas!

Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: This was my first time eating Indian food ever! And be experience was amazing. I suggest it to everybody.

Reviews.Author: Brian
Reviews.Content: Food is good, but the delivery experience was horrible - food was 30 minutes late and cold, but that wasn't the worst of it.  The driver called and told us we'd need to come down from our apartment to pick up the food from his car, rather than coming up to our apartment (we order delivery a lot and never have that problem).  When we got the food, we told the driver we'd be lodging a complaint, and he rudely told us he'd tell the restaurant never to deliver to us again.  We called and asked the manager for a refund, and he refused to even refund the tip we had pre-paid for the driver.  Horrible customer service, late delivery, cold food, rude driver, and no ownership of the issue from the manager.

Reviews.Author: Abhinav
Reviews.Content: Loved the food here. We had the lunch buffet and we really enjoyed it. This will be our go to place for Indian food in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: If I rated it on the food flavor alone, I would give it five stars. What's holding me back is the casual racism exhibited by the owners.   If you don't think white people can handle spicy food, just don't ask us how spicy they want it. Make us think you only offer it one way. But that's not what you did. You specifically asked how spicy I wanted my Vindaloo. I said,  Very spicy.  You looked at me like I was crazy, and asked again. I said,  Indian spicy , hoping that magical keyword would convince you. No, instead, you looked me in the eye and asked if it was for someone else. Had I not been ready to rob a bank for a Vindaloo, I would have left right then, but, at this point, I was committed. So, thinking that you finally were going to give me what I asked, I let it go, and we ordered the rest of our stuff.   The Vindaloo's spice level was somewhere between yogurt and a milk shake. Granted, it had a fantastic flavor, as did the Tikka Masala, the Mahkane, and the Saag Paneer. The Kashmir Naan was so delicious it brought a tear to my eye, and the Galub Jamun was top-notch. In fact, the only thing missing from my night of Indian food bliss was some vague tingle; some heat to let me know that I had eaten some spices. It was just not there.    I'll definitely order from here again, but I need to know what secret code I can give you so that you'll actually put some heat in my Vindaloo.

Reviews.Author: Claire
Reviews.Content: Thank you, Yelp, for finding me a place with delicious food, that's open late, not on the strip, and most importantly takes American Express!   Fantastic food. Great flavor! Ordered butter chicken, level 7 spicy (next time I'll order level 9, could be spicier for my taste), and buttered naan for take out. Wonderful service, very friendly staff, and food was ready in the exact amount of time they said. Wish I had found them earlier in my work trip!

Reviews.Author: Rae
Reviews.Content: By far the best food during my Vegas stay. I spent two weeks vacationing in Vegas and went to several restaurants everyday.   For dinner I had a yellow curry lamb dish. This dish is in my top three rated dishes of life. The chicken masala was the best that I've had. This place's lunch buffet easily beat out Caesar's palace buffet and was a fourth the cost.  I I will eat here anytime I'm in Vegas.

Reviews.Author: Dr Wendy
Reviews.Content: OMG!  I stumbled on this place about 8 weeks ago going to my favorite sushi joint.  Let me point out that I come from the UK and have eaten at some of the best Indian restaurants London has to offer, in addition to eating in the homes of my dear friends who cooked (some who are Chefs) for me on a regular basis.   As Las Vegas goes, key word here is  Las Vegas,  the buffet is amazing and is worth every penny.  We went for dinner about 3 weeks ago and ordered off of the menu and the food was very good!  I recommend that if you are looking for Indian food you give this place a try.

Reviews.Author: Swapnil
Reviews.Content: After 6 hours of long drive I reached Vegas and went to this restaurant. Amazing food....authentic indian food...we had shadi paneer, dal and palak paneer. We all loved it... I felt like I am eating in India...

Reviews.Author: Saliha
Reviews.Content: I love the food environment . It's affordable their chicken biryani, palak paneer are best plus there chilli chicken and reshmi kabab are good. Food variet is owsum gajar halwa , gulam jaman and butter naan and garlic naan are owsum I love this place.

Reviews.Author: Matt
Reviews.Content: Amazing Indian food. Hari was very accommodating. We kept it simple with chicken Vindaloo and the traditional chicken curry, but both were incredible. The paneer kulcha was the perfect vehicle to deliver these tasty morsels to our bellies. Check this place out if you are in the Las Vegas area and LOVE Indian cuisine. Highly recommended. Cheers!   I am ridiculously full.

Reviews.Author: Payal
Reviews.Content: Its the best Indian Restaurant that I came across in Vegas.They were ready to make jain dishes for us and all tasted so delicious that we went twice there. I must say that the ambience was pretty good as well and the place was neat and tidy. The willingness to cater to the customers' need is what blew my mind. I am gonna come here every time I visit Vegas. Will definitely recommend to all my friends:)

Reviews.Author: Ace
Reviews.Content: The food is delicious. I went there with my family today and ordered the paneer chili and chili chicken as appetizers. What can i say the appetizers was absolutely amazing. Try ordering it at a level 6-7 spicy and it will burn your mouth. Loved the Chicken Tikka Masala and Chicken Jalfrezi. They also have a check-in deal for yelp for a free lassi or soda. Last but not least one of my favorites was Gajar Halwa, it was nice and warm, and absolutely amazing. The prices are reasonable and cheap compared to other Indian Restaraunts around vegas. Chicken dishes are at $14 versus other restaraunts that have them for $18. They also have huge buffet for only $9.99. The most selections for the lowest prices. Now thats what i called a indian Buffet. I would deffinetly come back here again.

Reviews.Author: Balaji
Reviews.Content: Terrible. We did not receive appetizer or drink for 1 hour. Don't go by overall reviews. Poor management. No communication.

Reviews.Author: Jedi
Reviews.Content: Yum, yum,yum!!  Great selection of food.  Chilli chicken, naan bread, and all the others I don't remember the names but equally yummy.  Restaurant was very clean and the service was great.  Will definitely return.

Reviews.Author: Terese
Reviews.Content: We LOVED this place! The food selection on the lunch buffet was incredible and tasted amazing. We're pretty picky about our Indian food, and this place did not disappoint! They had some dishes new to us! Fav dish was the Chicken Tikka Masala. Flavors were nice & even. Some Indian buffets do not have much for a  salad  section, but here they did, with pickled items and a mango desert. We witnessed staff taking food temperature readings, which is a nice thing to see. It means they care about the customer. Very clean, & friendly staff. I lived out in NYC for a number of years, and this restaurant beats the places in Little India in Queens and the fancy places on the East side of Manhattan.

Reviews.Author: Arnaz
Reviews.Content: my husband and I came here after the sales associate at the pandora store at the forum recommended it.   for apps we had bhel puri, chili chicken and chicken momos. the bhel puri was nice and spicy. the tamarind chutney is as good as homemade. the chili chicken is a huge portion and could double as an entre. the momos were tasty also.  we then shared a non-veg thali and everything was divine. the best part was that the tabdoori chicken appetizer that comes with the thali wasn't hot pink in color (and it shouldn't be people just FYI) it was nicely BBQ'd and spiced beautifully. loved it!   finally, a true test for me, was the chai. perfection! I really enjoyed thai place and will definitely be back.   well done!

Reviews.Author: Stephen
Reviews.Content: Fantastic Indian buffet for lunch. Chicken tika and curried goat were excellent. Great service and atmosphere. Very good variety.

Reviews.Author: Sidney
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I decided to try this place after finding out our first choice restaurant had a 60 to 90 min wait.  Little did we know that we would end up waiting for 10 minutes before we were even given water and a chance to order, and another 50 minutes before our food would arrive.  And the restaurant was only half full!  After we finished eating, we called for the check and again, we were made to wait as we watched the guy who promised to bring us the check run around, refilling the potpourri bowl and ringing other customers up..basically doing anything but bringing us the check.    I guess the food was decent enough.  But I don't care how decent your food is, if you can't get your food out within a reasonable amount of time when your restaurant is only HALF full, then you've got an issue and you can forget about ever attracting your customers back.  As such, we could have stayed at our first choice restaurant and still ended up eating at around the same time.  We would also have saved on the gas money it took us to drive over to this place.

Reviews.Author: Taylor
Reviews.Content: Great buffet! Delicious food and amazing service :) The lunch buffet has a lot of great options especially if you don't eat meat!

Reviews.Author: Jacob
Reviews.Content: Excellent buffet. Large selection (including plenty of vegetarian). The restaurant is big and quite popular with both Indians and non-Indians alike. Everyone needs to try this!

Reviews.Author: C
Reviews.Content: Awesome!  Awesome! My fianc and I eat a lot of Indian food back home (Queens, NY) and I'll say this food is better than most we've eaten in NY. Sooo much flavor. Sooo many chooses for the buffet lunch. We visit Vegas often and were getting tired of eating like tourists and have decided to eat where the locals go. Everyone here is friendly and smiling. Very nice people. This is a family owned restaurant and we spoke with owner for a few minutes. Our water was always topped off and with so many food choices we practically rolled out of the place. We will definitely eat here every time we're in town.

Reviews.Author: Amareshwar
Reviews.Content: Good buffet with many items. All appetizers are good. chilli chicken is the killer. I will go again just for that. Biryani is not actual biryani. Dont go for it. Curries need some additional indian flavors. Overall the buffet is worth the money

Reviews.Author: Day-Trader
Reviews.Content: The lunch buffet was ok, I felt that the food was very spicy at least that part was authentic they didn't water down the spices. I had wished they had chicken tikka Marsala even though it's not an authentic Indian dish but it's a tasty dish.   I wasn't that impressed with the vegetarian curries, I'd would have liked it if they had Chana Marsala and vegi korma. I'm sure they rotate their dishes but the day I went I wasn't that happy with the buffet selection.   The naan was good and so was the mango lassi. That was the best part.

Reviews.Author: Momo
Reviews.Content: LUNCH BUFFET ONLY  How does one intelligently review an Indian buffet ? First off, India Delhi has the second largest population in the world and projected to surpass China within the next ten years. China has fifty-three ethnic minority groups. Where as India has thousands of enthic groups each with their unique cuisine.  Delhi Indian Cuisine is operated by two families, one Indian and the other Nepalese. While Mt. Everest India's Cuisine on the westside is owned and operated by just one Nepalese family.   I have dined at many wonderful Indian restaurant all over the US. Buffets are for the general public to sample Indian cuisine and are usually available during lunch. Dinner is always much more satisfying and my preferred way to really sample many od India's incredible cuisines. I also think it's important to know which region of India the head chef is from. It's important since the seasoning and method of cooking will be greatly influenced by his region of origin.  I've pretty much have tried all the Indian buffets in town and I would rank Delhi Indian Cuisine's buffetequal to the spicier Taj Palace on Eastern Avenue and certainly superior to Mt. Everest India's Cuisine makeshift buffet counter. My review of Taj Palace is available. Mt. Everest India's Cuisine had failed to impress me in more than one way, and I didn't bother to place a review.   My most favorite Indian buffet is served at the beautiful Royal Taj of Hanover, MD.  The family is from the region of Kashmir.

Reviews.Author: Christie
Reviews.Content: First time trying Indian food. Didn't know what to eat so we figured AYCE is a safe way to go to try everything.   All the food was delicious!!!   Be aware, some were spicier than I could handle. But the yummy mango lassi hit the spot.   Manager/owner was very nice and helpful. Prices are great.  Going to go back for dinner and try more items.   Only reason why they didn't get five stars was the service from the wait staff. The manager came to the table more than the young girl that was supposed to be the waitress.   Only one other table was eating besides us and she walked past our dirty plates and we had to flag her down to get drink refills.   Other than that. This will be our spot to go for curry and naan.

Reviews.Author: Rhowela
Reviews.Content: Wish I could give you 10 stars. Food is excellent. Buffet is a great price. Staff are friendly. Place is clean and beautiful. Nice dining experience.

Reviews.Author: Azi
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable n nice place to eat with great menu n choice of food  Desert  Gulab Jamun  is very delicious over ther good job guys !!

Reviews.Author: Green
Reviews.Content: Spacious restaurant with many food selections. Halal/zabiha meat. Tasty chicken curry. The owner was friendly.

Reviews.Author: Kumar
Reviews.Content: Food is mouth watering and service is awesome. They do care for your comfort, your oder and your taste  I would recommend to give it a try for once.

Reviews.Author: Eileen
Reviews.Content: Food and service were nothing short of amazing.  The menu featured some traditional dishes not seen elsewhere.  Besides a vegetarian menu section, there was also a wealth of vegan offerings.  We will absolutely be back.

Reviews.Author: Grace
Reviews.Content: The buffet was delicious without a doubt. Their bread is also very nice and well seasoned. I'm sure that if I was a fan of Indian good (I came with family), I would've loved it. Getting enough rice seems to help with the spices, but again, definitely great for people who are a fan. The service was amazing. They were very attentive. Although the food was spicy, it was of amazing quality!

Reviews.Author: U
Reviews.Content: Out for past 11 days and was tired of eating burgers and pizza, we wanted to have Indian food. While browsing yelp, we stumbled upon this place. Dinner was great, service was also good. Next day we tried their lunch buffet, and it was even better than last night's dinner. Lots of option, great taste and overall great service. I would recommend this place to my Friends visiting Vegas.

Reviews.Author: Yesenia
Reviews.Content: This place was great the food was delicious. We had the sev puri, all the ingredients tasted very fresh with just the right amount of spice. I also had the chicken tikka masala and it was also very good, they made it spicy to my specific request, even the nan was great.

Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: I had a GREAT Indian lunch here. The lunch buffet was huge with a very good selection. The food was HOT just the way it is supposed to be. The chicken was very tender and moist. The service was spot on. I will definitely be letting my friends know about this great restaurant.

Reviews.Author: Gigi
Reviews.Content: When we walked in this place was completely empty.  There were four of us and we ordered an appetizer/starter (samosa chatt), the tandoori sizzler, chicken vindaloo, chicken tika masala, rice and garlic naan. The food was all wonderful and service was good too. The only two things I didn't like is that our waiter didn't like the fact that we didn't order one entree per person ( you realize these dishes are meant to be for one person ), and the prices. I can get the same foods at many other Indian restaurants for less, larger portions and that have a better taste. I'm glad I went and tried it, but probably won't be back.

Reviews.Author: Amarjit
Reviews.Content: Best food and service. Best taste in Las Vegas veg korma, paneer kadahi, dal everything was tasting. Staff and restaurant very clean.

Reviews.Author: Sai
Reviews.Content: We went for a buffet on  Wednesday 12/14. They have a huge selection. Food tasted good. Samosa was the best. Naan was served at table. Naan was good. They won't serve you naan until you empty your naan basket even if it's the last bite left. Cmon guys I respect your sense of responsibility of not wasting food but don't give that reason to customers who need a naan. I don't want to wait for five minutes between my last bite and next bite. I know there might be people who waste lot of food in buffet but there must be a better way to refill Naan. You are already saving food by serving naan at table.

Reviews.Author: Rahul
Reviews.Content: This isn't good for vegetarians. The options were limited.. for about 13$ I expect more. Also the  restrooms weren't functional when we went.

Reviews.Author: Chantay
Reviews.Content: Amazing food and service! Highly recommended! We had the paneer tikka masala and paneer shahi with garlic and plain naan. Best Indian food in LV!

Reviews.Author: Kahley
Reviews.Content: Amazing Indian food! The buttered chicken and garlic naan are the best here! The service is great and a nice clean restaurant. Definitely will be coming back!

Reviews.Author: Nicole
Reviews.Content: I was lured in by the good yelp reviews, found myself in Vegas wanting some really good chicken tikka masala,  it wasn't terrible but I wasn't impressed. I like my food spicy so I ordered 7 out of 10 for the spice level.  When my food came out I was very surprised with the portion size I received a bowl of sauce and 8 of the smallest chunks of chicken, some which were dry while other pieces were mushy. The level of spiciness was perfect but the flavor of the food just wasn't there for me.  Service was great but the place was empty.  I wouldn't come back again.

Reviews.Author: Paula Josephine
Reviews.Content: My friend and I had dinner here after meeting the chef om wonderful food I enjoy the variety of naan bread and vegetable Thali relaxing atmosphere and very nice service I love going to aurhentic  restaurants where they actually have authentic music playing definitely will be coming back

Reviews.Author: Josh
Reviews.Content: I love this place! Naan is always delicious. Their lentil soup is hands down my favorite. Their dishes are tasty! I always get the American special -- chicken tiki masala. But I've tasted a few other dishes and I wasn't disappointed. Their service was quick and friendly, which is hard to come by! It's my go to Indian restaurant in Vegas.

Reviews.Author: Kathy
Reviews.Content: Amazing food and good service. We had goat Biryani and it was excellent! The vegetarian was very good as well. Whenever I come back to Vegas, will definitely come back and eat here!

Reviews.Author: Randy
Reviews.Content: OUTSTANDING!   When we walked in, we had our doubts.  The restaurant is pretty big, and the decor is very nice.  But it was 7:30PM and the place was literally empty.  Not one other customer.  Normally, this would have turned us off, but we decided to give it a try because of the good reviews on Yelp.  We were not disappointed.  My Butter Chicken was not the best I've ever had, but it was delicious with the perfect amount of spice.  My nephew said that his Tikka Masala was the best he's ever had.  He lives in Vegas and commented that he has a new  go to place  for Indian.  Our vegetable samosa's were very nice as well, but the reason I have to give five stars is because of the Chicken Pakora's.  They had the perfect amount of breading in comparison to the chicken.  The outside was just crispy enough, and the chicken on the inside was moist, tender, and juicy.  They were without a doubt the best pakora's I've ever had, and I've been to Indian restaurants all over the world.  The service was very friendly, and quick (granted, we were the only ones in the restaurant), and the prices were surprisingly reasonable.  Give Delhi Indian Cuisine a try if you are in Vegas and want a fantastic Indian meal.  You will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Author: Maulik
Reviews.Content: Perfect food !!! I ordered Paneer Tikka Masala Vegetable, Dal Makhani and Garlic Naan !!! All of them had amazing flavor and taste.. As a foodie, I would definitely recommend this restaurant for an authentic Indian gastronomic delight!! Deserves a sixth star for superb service..

Reviews.Author: Cindy
Reviews.Content: AAAA++++++++++++    This is by far the best tasting, decor, customer service and price ever!!!! The people here are very nice and the food is awesome for an indian lunch buffet. Huge selection and the price is amazing! I love it and I will be back very soon. When I saw indian people surrounding me ... I knew I found my pot of gold at the end of my rainbow for indian buffet!!! woohooo!!! The garlic nann bread is absolutely amazing.... order it.. order it NOW!!!!!  They are so good at topping off the food and if by chance you need something in the middle of your meal just ask someone they will be glad to help you. I was helped by a younger cubby boy and he was the sweetest waiter ever! He ran to assist me when I ordered an indian tea and then ran to get it and then I ordered a coke and he ran to fetch that and smiled ear to ear like it was the best day of his life to be at work.   I couldn't believe it was happening to me... amazing lunch for cheap and sweet little boy with fantastic customer service!!!!!

Reviews.Author: James
Reviews.Content: They do take American Express, but will try to talk you into using another card.  The food was decent, but I am rating them low due to how they scammed me into using a Visa card.

Reviews.Author: Mei-Lan
Reviews.Content: big lunch buffet  (10.95  $ )  with lots of things to choose from . it's a little bit on the spicy side , but not too much . food was fresh and the seasoning was good . free mango lassie or soda with yelp check in . free choice of regular or garlic naan .

Reviews.Author: J
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed the buffet selection- six meats - chicken and goat, multiple vegetable dishes, free naan, deserts, and they do not push you to start at the salad bar.   I didn't eat again all day.  If you are sensitive to spice, which I am, make sure you taste the dishes and avoid spicy curries (even the mildly hot ones are trouble!).  I had a bad experience later that evening.

Reviews.Author: Farishta
Reviews.Content: My husband and I came here for dinner our first night in Vegas.  Our dinner was so delicious that we decided to come back again the next night! This was the best Indian food we have had compared to places in San Francisco and Sacramento, CA. It has delicious food, great service and good prices. The restaurant is also nice and clean. The Tandoori Chicken was fresh and sizzling when it came to our table. The meat was tender and falling off the bones! We also had the Lamb Curry, Chicken Curry, and Chicken Tikka Masala. All of the curries were amazing with just the right amount of spices. The staff was friendly and accommodating. We will definitely be coming back here when we visit Vegas!

Reviews.Author: Boun
Reviews.Content: Food tasted pretty fresh and tasty for this buffet. They had a large variety to choose from. They had goat, chicken, and a lot of vegetarian options. Some of the items were pretty spicy. The item that stood out the most was their Garlic naan. It was exceptional. I've been to several Indian buffet back in my home state of Iowa so I was not sure what to expect here in Vegas. Heard a lot of good reviews so we tried this place out. I am giving it 3 stars because I expected the food to be a step above what I get in Iowa but I didn't get that. Sorry I just expect a little more when you are in Vegas. I would still recommend this place if you want Indian buffet because at $11.99 for lunch was pretty cheap for the variety you get.  Food - 3/5   Thought it would be better than what I get in Iowa, come on.... it's Vegas!!!  Service - 5/5  They refilled our drinks often and took our empty plates.

Reviews.Author: Jaddahti
Reviews.Content: What an excellent surprise!  Babygirl and I were out shopping in the area and were arguing - oops, I mean  discussing  our options along Maryland Parkway, and had finally reluctantly agreed to go to Jason's Deli, Turned out, the parking lot was jammed, it was unseasonably hot for October, and we were ready to turn that car around and go home when I remembered that the old soup place in the next lot over was now an Indian place. I admit I didn't hold out much hope, but it's a cuisine of which we are mutually fond, and I figured we could find SOMETHING good on the menu.  Yee hah! Turns out they featured the ubiquitous lunchtime buffet, so we could try it all.  The tandoori chicken was surprisingly moist, the butter chicken rich and tasty, and the curry had a satisfying kick. There were lots of vegetarian options involving rice, lentils, spinach, etc., which I never got to. Not because I don't like them; I happen to believe that All Foods Matter, but I had slurped up so much sauce with that nice hot naan, that I had to tap out. Did manage to wash down a big glop of sweetened carrots that made a fine, if unintended, dessert.  Might have been a four star, but it's getting five because there was actual meat in all those steam table trays, not just the sauce with a few barely detectable chunks as is too often the case at Indian buffets. Good job.   Highly recommend that next time you're in the area, skip the  Deli  and hit the  Delhi .  (Did you see what I did there? Hee hee hee).

Reviews.Author: Amy
Reviews.Content: I am sorry this restaurant is not closer to our part of town, for when we are craving Indian food! My husband and I stopped in for their lunch buffet. A great selection, and all the food tasted fresh. I thought the particular standouts were the Goat Curry, the onion bhaji, and the garlic naan. I love goat, and of course its not easy to find in the U.S., and this is a staple on Delhi's buffet. Goat meat is a little stronger tasting than beef, and stood up to the sauce very well. The cuts of meat are on-the-bone...I wanted to dive in with my fingers and grab each piece and gnaw it clean!  The onion bhaji was crisp and tasty; not greasy at all. And the garlic naan was light and chewy and very, very fresh. I'm not a big fan of the bright yellow curry sauces, but my husband reported that the Punjabi curry was very good. The saag paneer was good also.. The tandoori chicken wasn't as highly spiced as I like, but it was moist enough to be tasty. Like the onion bhaji, the samosas were crisp, not soggy, and had a nice flavor. The biryani rice was a little greasy, but that was probably my only real nitpick with any of the dishes. They also have the standard side sauces, raita and mint sauce. We could have eaten those all day long, with baskets of naan! For dessert, there was warm carrot halwah (very tasty, but a little odd to us; not quite a side dish; not quite a dessert); and one other selection. You'll have to look for the  samia  (I've always known it as  kheer ), at the back of the salad table. It's not labeled as a dessert, and it's right next to the similar-looking raita sauce. If you aren't familiar with it, its a sweet milk and vermicelli-noodle pudding flavored with cardamom. I like mine with more cardamom, but this was a nice cool & sweet ending to a spicy lunch :-)  With one soda pop, our meal for 2 was about $25, and well worth it. Rather than cook just one main dish at home, we enjoyed being have a lot of good Indian food at one meal. Oh, and the employees were very friendly as well!

Reviews.Author: Nicole
Reviews.Content: Delhi Indian cuisine is nothing short of delightful, as soon as you walk in you are overwhelmed (in the best way possible) by the most wonderful smells. You are immediately greeted by staff,  seated, and walked through their menu. We chose what I can best describe as a sampler platter. It was so great, we will be coming back soon, promise.

Reviews.Author: Riley
Reviews.Content: Holy cow do not come here today. It's about 95 degrees and 95% humidity inside here! I came here to dine on authentic Indian cuisine not dine in authentic Indian summer heat. On top of everything being very spicy and no ice in your drinks. Was never asked if we wanted drinks. We were never offered menus. We never even had a server. The food was ok. I would assume it was very authentic and that is why they have such good reviews on here. I would hope that ordering off the menu would be better. The pictures on Yelp are definitely not from the buffet. 1 extra star because on the plus side I lost three pounds due to excessive sweating;)!

Reviews.Author: Mohini
Reviews.Content: We came to this restaurant with our friends thrice during our 3 days stay in Vegas. The buffet was amazingly awesome. Everything was freshly made and had lots of varieties both north and south Indian cuisines. Do try the golgappas here, I must say it was yummy.. We had thali in our dinner..u can only finish the thali, if your hunger level is 5 out of 5. Restaurant is well maintained. I recommend it to everyone atleast to try once.

Reviews.Author: Athar
Reviews.Content: Yes LORD! The buffet is amazing!!! It's so comprehensive and the display is also fantastic. Really well seasoned food.

Reviews.Author: Anupama
Reviews.Content: Great food and great people! The hosts were wrapping up when we walked in but they still accommodated us. We went with a simple order of jeera rice and chicken curry with beverages and raita. The food was original to the Indian palate. The hosts were possibly the best I've met! Must check it out if you have an Indian craving in Vegas

Reviews.Author: Vince
Reviews.Content: Brought the family for lunch buffet on a Sunday. Their lunch buffet is $11.99. A really good price for all the food they offer in their lunch buffet. They have the usual chicken curry, chicken makhani, goat curry, tandoori chicken, chicken biryani, reshmi kabab, etc. For the veggie dishes they had Paneer Saag, Aloo ghobi etc. They had alot more I just cant remember everything. I just remember not being able to decide what to take because there were so many options and my plate was full just have way down the buffet line. They had lots of veggie options including salads, chutneys, pickles, raita and more!   We had great service from the time we walked in and throughout our entire stay. The servers were friendly and checked on us often. The food was very good. Everything was cooked right and very flavorful. Their regular and garlic naan was soft and delicious. All the food was fresh too, not sitting out for hours. The meat curries and biryani had nice big pieces of meat. Some places have more sauce than meat. I think we found our new favorite Indian restaurant in Vegas. We all felt like eating more and more even past the point of not being hungry anymore and stuffing our tummies with extra food.  Good service, great food, friendly staff, clean restaurant and restrooms. Great overall experience and looking forward to coming back.

Reviews.Author: Tanya
Reviews.Content: The best Indian food in vegas ever. Nice staff, plenty space,no reservation need. Chicken masala is so smooth and creamy, melting in mouth. Try garlic naan! Will be back for sure.

Reviews.Author: Weber
Reviews.Content: You get your moneys worth for a very good Indian lunch buffet.

Reviews.Author: Beth
Reviews.Content: My sister and I we were craving Indian food for dinner , I've been to mint, Mt . Everest, Indian oven.. hands down we found the best one yet, Delhi Indian Cuisine is truly the best. And the setting is great, Hari the one who help us was awesome. Don't think twice about it, eat  and enjoy..

Reviews.Author: Leigh Anne
Reviews.Content: Passing through Las Vegas, found this place on Yelp! Amazing experience! Food was fantastic, fresh, plentiful and diverse and each dish had its own, unique flavor. Staff was friendly and provided excellent service. The establishment was also clean and well maintained.      Will not pass through without another visit!

Reviews.Author: David
Reviews.Content: I'm a foodie for Indian and many places in town do not have the variety as Delhi Indian. Their selections are vegan friendly, meat, and they even have some salad/desert bar. The service was by far the best, staff is very friendly and accommodating. Looking forward to my next visit.

Reviews.Author: Keith
Reviews.Content: Overall not bad experience. The restaurant itself was clean and was surprisingly not very busy for a weekend evening. The food itself was actually pretty good, the best in Vegas I've had yet, but still falls short compared to other big cities with a larger Indian population. Service was great, no complaints there.

Reviews.Author: Gyanaranjan
Reviews.Content: Excellent place to get Indian buffet. I highly recommend to have food there as it's worth. The service is really good and the variety is awesome. Lastly you will get high value for what you spend.

Reviews.Author: R
Reviews.Content: People who say that this is a good Indian restaurant have never eaten Indian before!! Seriously! I have eaten at Indian restaurants all over the U.S. I get it if the food is lil less spicy and all but the food here is completely tasteless. As if you are eating some kind of mashed taste less stuff. We tried the buffet and seriously we didn't like a single item. And not only that we had severe stomach ache after few minutes, maybe it was the baking soda or something I have no clue. I would say do yourself a favor and don't go to this place!

Reviews.Author: Jeff
Reviews.Content: I'm a Vegas local, and Delhi is my go-to Indian restaurant. High marks on service, price, atmosphere, selection, and taste! Vegan friendly too!

Reviews.Author: Willie
Reviews.Content: Well people I have to say nothing less than ..OMG!! Hands down the best Indian restaurant i have ever been to.The service and the food went together like bonnie and clydeI had a sizzling plate with a variety of meats,  and bed of rice with their naan bread.. Will definently be returning soon!!

Reviews.Author: Tony
Reviews.Content: If you don't make it to the lunch buffet, Everything  on the menu is  la cart, we assumed that our order would have came with rice or naan when ordering, but the waitress was quick corrected us. Her mood seemed to change quickly when we were not interested in the drink menu she provided. While waiting for our food we noticed a dead silence due to the fact that there was no music playing. A few moments pass by and a gentleman with a really upbeat attitude came over and delivered a little snack while we waited for our food. When the food arrived , it looked amazing! The flavors were perfect along with the spice level that I had picked. I ordered the chicken tikka masala with rice and garlic naan. One garlic naan and white rice can be split between two people but the chicken tikka masala could not.  The restaurant has a promotion going on that says   free dessert when you check in on Yelp  my fianc told our waitress that we checked in and she said we would also have to write a review. She stayed with our table to watch my fianc write the review and she then gave us a choice between rice pudding or a pastry. The pastry tasted like a pancake with liquid sugar. It was really good. OVER ALL, the restaurant could use background music, and maybe a little better costumer service, but the food was perfect for the most part. For $45 I paid for 2 white rice, 2 garlic naan, and 2 chicken tikka masala. It was worth it but in the future I now know that the naan and rice and be shared.

Reviews.Author: Birdy
Reviews.Content: Great Indian cuisine.  Resurant is lovely and clean.  Staff are very good and friendly. Went for the lunch  time buffet and was grea. , Service good, prices good we would diffinately  recommend.

Reviews.Author: Sanjay
Reviews.Content: Amazing food and fresh buffet. Indian style nan was very fresh with different types,  Would love to go again and again.

Reviews.Author: David
Reviews.Content: I was like you once. Looking on yelp for the best indian food option. Knowing that these places on the strip weren't worth their prices but wondering what other joints still offer good food, good service, and nice atmosphere (because, hey, you're vacationing in Vegas and you don't need to be slumming it at some filthy ethnic place to save $10 you'll just lose on a side bet anyways). Well, this is the answer. Do not look at any other reviews because New Dehli is where you want to go.  Just a few months old, it has a slew of positive reviews and -- as great as the food was (there is a mango lassi free with your check in that you MUST get) -- the pride the staff/owners put into the restaurant is apparent with every detail of the restaurant. From the decor to the menu to the EXCELLENT service, New Dehli is what comes to mind (for me, at least) when we talk about  shopping local . This is their restaurant and I saw in my visit that the owners truly care about this place. These folks took out a space in a shopping center (plenty of parking!) and have created a truly sincere dining experience. Maybe it's not something I can explain well -- but if you'd like to understand, swing by New Dehli on a Thursday evening and take in the experience. Never have a rooted this hard for a restaurant in a city I've only been visiting.

Reviews.Author: Sam
Reviews.Content: Before entry into the restaurant, the parking lot for the restaurant was very room. The moment you enter the front door, you can sense a classy vibe that is being emitted from with in. All the tables have cloth napkin and wine glass style cups that were set already. Inside the restaurant it was very well designed, tables were placed in a well designed arrangement, and in the back near the kitchen entrance there is a bar. The workers are very tentative to every customers needs.   The food that we ate was the Butter Chicken, the chicken was presented in a curry pot, the color of the of the curry is a bright dark orange, the aroma from the food smelt like tomato with the smell of curry, a very sweet aroma. At first taste, you can taste the butter, cream, curry and, tomato. The texture of the chicken was very smooth and soft. The flavor from the butter chicken gave a buttery/creamy/curry taste and a sweet smell in your mouth.  This was a first time having Indian Cuisine and the service was great, I highly recommend this restaurant.

Reviews.Author: Niccole
Reviews.Content: Their food was great! Customer service was definitely okay. I came in two consecutive days for my lunch break at the beginning of the buffet lunch. Initially, no one was there to greet me but I was noticed quickly. I told them I wanted buffet to go and he said okay. Then proceeded to sit two groups of people, grab them all waters, and then come back and ask me if I wanted a to go box. Obviously I did so he took another 5 minutes or so to grab me so styrofoam containers. This didn't happen the second day I came in as I went straight to a waiter that recognized me and told them I wanted to-go again.  The food is amaze-balls! It's on the spicy side, so for someone who likes their curry mild beware! That's why I'm giving them 4 stars instead of 3 for the service. $10 for as much as you can stuff into 3 containers is great to me! Also, I forgot to get dessert so I ask the waiter if I could get a little cup. He gave me a little side sauce cup, but he could have said no so I'll still give credit where it's due!

Reviews.Author: Suki
Reviews.Content: Subsequent to a long day at work and with a gift certificate in my love's hand, we were on our way to cash in at Delhi Indian Cuisine. It was a bit of a drive across town for us, but we would soon discover that it was well worth the drive on this blustery night in Vegas. When we arrived it was rather quite with only a few tables of guests, but we were welcomed with a warm greeting that soon transformed into thorough service in their clean space with simple yet pleasing ambiance.  We took most of our server's suggestions after talking about our likes and dislikes. Most dishes have a spice range from one to ten. We opted to stay right in the middle and asked for some separate spicy sauce to add...the spice on the side was very spicy, just the way I like.  We ordered Garlic Naan, Nepali Vegetable Momos, Butter Chicken with dark meat, Lamb Dhansak, Baingan Bharta, and Mango Lassi. Dinner also comes with complimentary Papadum & Chutney. Everything was delicious and exotic.   My favorites were the Momos and Butter Chicken. The Momos are Nepali dumplings--folded fresh and juicy with curry dipping sauce on the side...I enjoyed these dumplings very much, especially the excellent wrapper of the Momos...not too thick and not too thin.  I am used to Japanese and Thai Curry but this Indian Curry was made of different layers of spices and full of great flavor. To cool it all down we had a Mango Lassi...made with Yogurt and Mango...yummy.  According to Yelp Reviews, lunch buffet at Delhi Indian Cuisine is must...so I am planning to come back to satisfy my appetite for Indian meals.

Reviews.Author: Bobby
Reviews.Content: Tried it once so far. Loved the lunch buffet. Check-in offer at the time of this review is still one free soda or lassi, which is a cool bonus for what is already a great deal ($9.99 lunch buffet).  Impressed by the gingery Dal Tadka, and the savory and slightly sweet Navratan (veggie) Korma. They were cool with making us Roti (whole wheat) instead of regular Naan, and I thought the size of the Tandoori Chicken pieces was encouraging. Smaller chicken pieces indicate less hormones, and a more expensive bird. It's the first dish you will see on the buffet, and is a good representation of the rest of it. Quality ingredients made with care in quantity - these are some of the largest chafing dishes you will see on a Indian buffet, ever!  Looking forward to the next visit, and hopefully an upgrade to a string of *red* stars.  Way to go, Delhi! Keep it up please!

Reviews.Author: Kishan
Reviews.Content: Food was average during dinner time. Soup was very spicy even after reminding the staff twice.

Reviews.Author: Leticia
Reviews.Content: We went to eat at this restaurant today. It was my Husband Birthday and after reading the good reviews, we decided to go to this place.  What a disappointment!, the food was cold, the taste nothing to impress, the waiter was rude, bossy and impatience with us.  I do not recommend it.

Reviews.Author: Rocky
Reviews.Content: Best Indian Buffet in Vegas. Beats Mint India buffet both in size, convenience and the choice of food. You have to try their reshmi kebabs.  My server was Krishna and he redefines customer service.  I would go there again.

Reviews.Author: Crystal
Reviews.Content: Wow- my husband and I are vegetarians from phoenix who love indian food, and we loved this place!   The food was very flavorful and colorful - some unique items. It was presented elegantly, with a good selection of alcoholic beverages.   Also, the owner came to our table and was very polite, asking us if there was anything we needed.   Don't usually eat much dairy, but we got the free mango lassi and it was to die for!   Definitely check this place out! It's HUGE so it would be great for big parties. Good atmosphere with lots of natural light.

Reviews.Author: Saydie
Reviews.Content: My family and I came to Vegas back in August for a vacation. We were craving Indian Food so we decided to try this place out. In three days we ate here twice. The food for an Indian Buffet was very good. Their variety of dishes was nice from classic muglai to chinese, their gulab jamun are the best I have had in a buffet and believe me I have been to many. The staff was very attentive however the owner not so much. We had to wait quite a while for our naan to come out and requested the owner many times. The second time we went back was better, of course now he recognized us. Overall a good buffet if you are in the Vegas area

Reviews.Author: Nicole
Reviews.Content: We got here at 1100 and the food wasn't quite ready yet, so we ended up waiting until about 11:10 which wasn't that big a deal. The place was clean, the decor was warm and inviting, the hostess was really nice and the food was GREAT. I've never tried Indian food up until this point so I don't have much to compare to but I do love food and trying new things and I was impressed, the bread they gave us was hot and fresh (and free) and the mango lassi was so good! I loved the food on the buffet and the fruits at the salad table were so fresh. The waiter came around multiple times during lunch to check on us. It got progressively busier by 1130 but we didn't feel neglected at all. I'll come back to this place for sure.

Reviews.Author: Anika
Reviews.Content: Worth every penny to eat here. Service was excellent. Loved the chicken tikka with the peas polau!!! Delicious.... Must try the naan too, fresh & soft.

Reviews.Author: Richard
Reviews.Content: YELP SHOULD OFFER 10 stars!!!!!!! This place gets it!! absolutely amazing this is the best indian food we have ever had the pleasure eating!!! the staff is awesome and attentive !!?soooooooo worth every penny spent the sheer amount of food lol is crazy!!!!!!!

Reviews.Author: Patrick
Reviews.Content: Great food, great prices, great service. Everything about this place is great. Got the palak aloo, lamb korma, and garlic naan. Washed it all down with a tasty strawberry lassi. Highly recommend to any lovers of Indian cuisine. Goung to come back and try the buffet soon.

Reviews.Author: Maddy
Reviews.Content: Food is amazing here . Best buffet I have ever had .  They had awseom malai kofta and Naan.Food is not expensive too. They have very good service too :)

Reviews.Author: Adam
Reviews.Content: Great atmosphere. One of the best waiters we ever had!! The is the first time eating Indian food and because of the perfect wait staff it won't be the last! ( haven't got our dishes yet so can't say on the food yet! Our bread with sauces ( in the pic) is great though)  By the way the food was perfect also! Got to try the garlic naan too. Been in vegas almost a week and hands down the best place we ate so far and definitely the best service! Thank you Dehli!

Reviews.Author: Nneka
Reviews.Content: 2 thumbs up!! Lots of clearly labeled veggie options.  Excellent never-ending garlic naan with the buffet.  Large selection, great service and very clean.

Reviews.Author: Saurabh
Reviews.Content: If you want to eat good Indian food this is the place. Chicken curry and daal is very nice, service is amazing, nice place to have North Indian food

Reviews.Author: Payal
Reviews.Content: A must-visit restaurant when in Vegas and craving for Indian food. The food portion is huge, fresh and tasty, restaurant is hygienic and the service is prompt and impeccable. We were a group of five comprising of my husband, my MIL and my parents. My family can be a bit fussy and choosy when it comes to food but they all thoroughly enjoyed the food served here. We went for a vegetarian thali, sev puri, momos, chilly chicken, and chicken curry with assorted bread. No disappointments whatsoever! We were served by Hari and Krishna. They were both extremely courteous, prompt and accomodating when it came to our preferences. Special shout- out to Hari who went out of his way to give us the best service possible. Highly recommend this restaurant for its service, ambience and taste. Definitely worth giving it a shot!

Reviews.Author: Abe
Reviews.Content: We walked for 2 miles from the strip for this and we were not disappointed with the quality and flavor of the food.  It was Awesome!!!

Reviews.Author: Rajesh
Reviews.Content: This is my first review on yelp and you can imagine how disappointed i am that i took the pain of writing this review.   Probably the worst food in terms of quality that i had in my recent memory. Please do not waste your time and money at this place.

Reviews.Author: Eric
Reviews.Content: Very good Indian lunch buffet. They even do it on weekends! Fantastic garlic Naan complimentary as well.

Reviews.Author: C
Reviews.Content: Truly some of the best Indian my wife and I have ever had and there were some great Indian places in Phoenix where we lived previously.   As others have stated, the Naan is pretty much the best I've tasted in Las Vegas. The lunch buffet is very good with a wide, fresh selection. I also order take out a couple times a month to bring home to the wife and kid for dinner.   Every staff member there is beyond nice and super attentive to boot! Highly recommended.

Reviews.Author: Mary
Reviews.Content: I went during the lunch buffet.  Clean establishment,  friendly staff.   The buffet offered some common dishes like tandoori, samosas, butter chicken as well as a few of out of the ordinary ones (curry goat).   Mango Lassi is always delish.  There are a few items on the buffet that I find to be the best I've ever tasted (when compared to other Indian restaurants):  pakora, chile chicken,  chicken tikka masala, and galub jamun.  To me, the flavors are perfect.  I do wish they would add mango chutney to the buffet.

Reviews.Author: Cammy
Reviews.Content: I ordered delivery while on a work trip from CA. Ordered quite a spread too - chicken korma, saag paneer, rice, papadums, roti, kheer, mango lassi, and 1 other appetizer. Not only did I have enough for 3 people, but the food was delicious!!! Perfectly spiced and beautifully prepared. I would definitely recommend this restaurant, and would definitely order again next time I am in town!

Reviews.Author: Baban
Reviews.Content: Thank you yelp once again! While roaming the streets of LV, I got the craving for some food from the homeland. After some bad experiences with lunch indian buffets in the past here, my hopes were pretty low.  I have to say I'm vegetarian so while many may love indian buffets with great meat options, I usually am stuck with like two non-appetizing vegetarian options. Not the case here!! The buffet was huge! Filled up half the restaurant! And the food was delicious!! Naan-amazing Samosas- to die for! (I ate like 3) Korma- almost fell out of my chair! Even the dal was good!

Reviews.Author: Nick
Reviews.Content: Food was great! I was a little bummed I missed the buffet, but that melted away after eating a level 10 spice chicken tikka masala.  I'll definitely be back next time I'm in Vegas to try out the buffet!  Also Keema Naan was very good.

Reviews.Author: Poorva
Reviews.Content: Delicious food ! Considerate and hospitable with the service.  We did a to-go. They made tava rotis on special request, even if that is not on the menu. Sweet!  Would definitely stop by next time if I want Indian food.

Reviews.Author: Frank
Reviews.Content: Well appointed great service and amazing food. Make sure that you get garlic naan. Had the lunch buffet. The chicken makkani ( which I would compare to chicken tikki masala) melts in your mouth. The goat curry falls off the bone. Everything was Great!

Reviews.Author: Rafael
Reviews.Content: My wife and I came for the lunch buffet.  The food was excellent in taste and variety.  We had eaten at Mt. Everest a month ago and had tasted it a bit too salty.  The service was excellent.  There seemed to be a good balance of vegetarian/vegan and chicken or goat options.  Nice salad section and 3 dessert choices as well as honey dew, cantaloupe and orange wedges.  Oh, and let me not forget the naan.  We got plain and garlic and both were fresh, tasty and plentiful.  I think next time though, we'll get ALL garlic naan though...it was that good.  We most definitely will be back again.  Rafael

Reviews.Author: maria
Reviews.Content: Delicious. My mom wanted Indian food, and she couldn't stop raving about how everything tasted. The Lassi deal for checking in was pretty sweet too. It sucks that it's off the main tourist hub, which means you'll need a cab to get there, but it was definitely worth it.

Reviews.Author: Pierre
Reviews.Content: This review is for the dinner.   On a recent trip to Vegas, a friend recommended I leave the strip (its like 3 blocks away so not that far I guess) and eat at Delhi. I love Indian food so I gave it a shot. If I didn't like Indian food before, this would have sold me for sure!   The food was a solid 5/5. We had the butter chicken and the malai kofta. We also started with some classic somosas. Everything was fantastically delicious. The somosas were crisp and yet fluffy on the inside. The butter chicken was a little spicy, creamy, and melt in your mouth all at once. The kofta was a dish I had never tried before but was pleasantly surprised because the curry it was in was the best curry I have had to date. We topped it off with garlic naan and life was perfect.  The servers were always attentive. This is the kind of place where you will never see a water glass empty. To be fair, we were one of two parties dining at that time (they had just opened for dinner 2 minutes prior to us arriving) so mileage may vary.  Finally, the price was most definitely right. That entire meal I described came out to like $40 which left me and my gf who I was eating with bursting at the seams. I can't say enough about how great this place is.

Reviews.Author: Harry
Reviews.Content: Great Buffet.  Love the variety. Had a good selection of meat and bread.  Will go there again.

Reviews.Author: Srikanth
Reviews.Content: Its very tasty and there are lot of items to eat during buffet. Enjoyed idli and sambar, chicken and goat curries and dessert a lot. Naans were very soft too. This surpassed my expectations :)

Reviews.Author: Sandhya
Reviews.Content: Excellent lunch buffet. They had a good spread for vegetarians as well. The owner was nice and came by the table many times to check on us. Much better than other Indian fares on the strip -- similar taste but much better price and service.

Reviews.Author: Eranda
Reviews.Content: It's all good but most of the plates don't have any meat. Also there are no desert at all. However they are really friendly and nice.

Reviews.Author: Neelam
Reviews.Content: We came here for dinner after checking the high rating in yelp. It took 20 minutes for us to even get a waiter. Another 20 minutes for our beer to come. We ordered bhindi masala and goat biryani. Apparently no curry comes with a side .. Which is disappointing.. We ordered tandoori roti .. After 40 minutes wait .. Finally our food arrived .. Goat biriyani had 4 small pieces of goat .. Thats it! My bhindi masala tasted blant and had the top head of bhindi in it ( which is typically discarded as garbage) .. It took us forever to get our bill .. So once we gave our credit card we had to wait 20 more minutes.. So we just went to cashier instead.. So in the end .. We arrived at 7.55 and left at 9.35! And irony is it was just two of us and we didn't order much .. Its totally unprofessional and hotel management should really look into this .. We were so tired waiting that instead of playing in casino we just hit the sack!

Reviews.Author: Heidi
Reviews.Content: I loved their lunch buffet! Lots of vegetarian options as well as options for meat eaters

Reviews.Author: Divin
Reviews.Content: Bad customer service. Made us wait for 40 mins before serving anything! They assured us that they will give us food now and it never came. After we repeatedly told them that its long time we are waiting, give us or we will walk away. Then, they started serving.  Food was ok and not great taste. It was bit salty and looks like made in hurry. Also few items was missing from vegetarian thali.  4 star reviews are I believe because of incentive of free Lassi. It is not worth even 2 star with this kind of customer dining service !

Reviews.Author: Narda
Reviews.Content: I'm so glad i decided to have Indian cuisine for the first time.  It was delicious!  I tried the garlic namn bread n the regular.  Regular one was my favorite.  The price was very reasonable. The buffet is the way to go of you're new to it.  I tried a bite size of everything then went back for seconds of my favorites. Loved the goat curry... but many others were great.  Namn bread is brought freshly made.

Reviews.Author: Jay
Reviews.Content: I was never a fan of Indian food because the spice was just too over powering and you could not enjoy the flavors of the food. But at Delhi they will tone down the spiciness of the food so you can actually taste the food. Now we (my wife and I) love to eat Indian as often as we can, we even take our out of town guest there! Having only eaten there for dinner, I am unable to comment on their lunch buffet.

Reviews.Author: Jasmine
Reviews.Content: This place was the only vegan friendly restaurant open, so my girlfriend and I stopped by for a bite. Food was delicious, but we ended up getting too much. We had snacked on the way into Vegas so our original order of palak aloo and garlic roti would've been enough. However, our waiter convinced us portions were smaller so we added something else to our order. The food was incredibly spicy so we didn't even eat much of the added dish.

Reviews.Author: Prasad
Reviews.Content: Excellent food! Warm people and patient service. The entire family loved their custom flavored and spiced menu. Any days choice!! Go and meet Krishna. He loves people coming to this place and serving them with lot of affection.

Reviews.Author: Syed
Reviews.Content: I am good cook of Indian and Pakistani food, so my standard for Indian and Pakistani food is pretty high. In my 35 years I've been to countless Indian and Pakistani restaurant in US and I always get disappointed in at least 95% of restaurant I have been. I am from Bay Aria there is only one good Pakistani restaurant in SF, Fremont name Shalimar, I used to travel 2 hrs. drive from Sacramento to Fremont just to eat at this restaurant to me Shalimar on scale 10. When I go to any Indian and Pakistani restaurant I compare it to Shalimar. I just recently move to Las Vegas and start trying new restaurant and came across Delhi Cuisine restaurant and scale 1 to 10 its up there at 8 and believe me every other restaurant  I've been never cross more than 4 on scale. The best Indian Buffet restaurant, place is clean service is great and food is absolutely delicious fresh and tasty. Usually they have about 25 different dishes to choose from.  fresh plain or garlic nan the buffet is only for $10. You cannot beat that. I go there at least every other day for lunch. If you are looking for Indian and Pakistani food in Las Vegas this is the only place in town try it and you will love it.

Reviews.Author: Bhumitra
Reviews.Content: Very poor service  Too slow. Took forever to take the order and then we had to wait 1 hour to get the food.   That too at non peak hours The restaurant was 20% capacity.    Very slow. Went by the yelp reviews but poor service

Reviews.Author: Jeff
Reviews.Content: I came here for dinner because I am traveling solo for business and they offer a thali (a kind of combo plate), which is great because I enjoy variety. It was wonderful. The tandoori chicken appetizer (2 pieces, almost a meal in itself) was amazing and the assortment of dishes was just right. If you like Indian you must try this place.

Reviews.Author: sunder
Reviews.Content: To start with I have been lazy on this review I ate here couple of months ago when I was in Vegas last and I owe them this review cause I searched them on yelp and boy was I glad to have landed there with my wife. We were greeted very warmly and shown around the dishes they served that day in buffet wich was priced very reasonably at 10.99 . Food was delicious we loved chicken Tikka masala and couple of other chicken and veg dishes ghot curry was great and we simply fell in love with the punjabi curry witch was finger licking good ( we Indians eat with hands  not forks) desserts were also good as was the service . I would definrtly recomend it to every one and will definetly eat here when I visit Vegas again

Reviews.Author: Jagadeesh
Reviews.Content: I was travelling through Las Vegas and found this restaurant through Yelp. Thanks to it. It seems a new restaurant and 5 to 10 mins away from strip. I usually go to Gandhi but found this better for various reasons. This have plenty of parking space for vehicles and plenty of area for dining.  We are larger group with three kids and  we need a plenty of space to move around. This restaurant was perfect for us. Coming to the food it was better than other Vegas Indian food i tasted. Since it became crowded the items are fresh that makes it delicious . I wont find anything in the heating tray for longer time. It always better to go early for buffets, we went late by 2pm so some of the vegeterian trays are already over so we got a little wait time for the foods to be prepared and filled up.  The Non veg starters are more , so you will get good options. This is typical north indian resturant so you cant expect a South indian briyani or the idly at its best. But its typical briyani and an better idly served at north indian resturant.  The butter nan and garlic nan was really delicious.   And at that time there was option to get a Mango lassi for yelp check in, Its really very good. I found this as best among Indian resturants in Vegas.

Reviews.Author: Craig
Reviews.Content: Great food. Some of the best Indian food I've had. Ate their Tahli, and each portion was perfect in every way. The waitstaff was also professional, helpful and pleasant. I wish they were closer....

Reviews.Author: Elizabeth
Reviews.Content: Came in for the lunch buffet. Great food and excellent service! Garlic naan came with the lunch buffet. Mango lassi was delicious. As others have stated, lots of variety. Food was hot and tasted fresh. We will be back for sure!

Reviews.Author: Emad
Reviews.Content: It is the best Indian restaurant you can find near UNLV. My favorite go to always tandoori chicken, do not forget to ask for hot and fresh baked garlic bread. Try goat as well it was so tender and tasty.  If you are student, show your student card and get 10% off!!!!

Reviews.Author: Madelyn
Reviews.Content: We were on a 4 day trip to Vegas and took a taxi here for the lunch buffet. IT WAS AMAZING!!! Highly recommend you do the same. The strip is so expensive that you will pay less all around by coming off of it to this place for lunch even with the taxi. My husband is the pickiest eater out there and he says it was better than his favorite Indian place at home! The mango lassi was also the best I have had. Good job guys!

Reviews.Author: Luis
Reviews.Content: Great food, great service. Make sure to get garlic Naan. I'll definitely go back for some more. I sample a little bit of everything, but my favorite was goat curry by far. Plus you can't beat the price around $10.00 dollars for their lunch buffet .!

Reviews.Author: Nausherwan
Reviews.Content: This is another good Indian restaurant in Vegas. This restaurant's goal is high volume, as is apparent with its large layout and seating capacity (100+ people could dine here). The buffet is great, with the chili and tandoori chicken dishes being my personal favorite.

Reviews.Author: Norbie
Reviews.Content: The BEST place to get your masala fix! The place to be whether you want an extensive vegan Indian spread or if you are a carnivore at heart. The lunch buffet spread is impressive. For only $10.99 you have transported your palate to India aboard the royal elephants with the cool Maharajas of Rajasthan.  The staff are attentive ... make that very attentive and friendly. Pleasant ambiance, glass goblets, paper lined white tablecloths and linen napkins.  The food speaks for its self. The flavors are so pure, complex and divine. You can taste the unique blends of masala spices like cardamom, turmeric, fennel are noticeable. From the Dals, Curries, Pulaou, Tandooris to the Koftas, Paneer, Tikkas and Kormas - the food is awesome. Plus the condiment section is amazing: lime chutney, tamarind sauce, chili peppers, corriander chutney, Raita etc are just nice touches to make your experience unforgettable. Fresh Naan brought to your table bubbly, crusty and pipping hot! I love this place. I drove 17miles to get here and it was worth it. Give this place a try.

Reviews.Author: sandra
Reviews.Content: My first experience with Indian Cuisine, very good! First of all, the place looks great, very clean and great service, all the staff is friendly and attentive. I tried the buffet, keeping in mind that is the first time I try Indian Cuisine and I don't have any other experience to compare with, I liked it a lot!!! The garlic bread is really good, I tried all the vegetarian plates; I was a little worried about the food being very spicy, but it wasn't. Overall I enjoyed the food and will definitely recommend this place to my friends.

Reviews.Author: Tiffany
Reviews.Content: Came back last night and I'm trying to decide about removing one star or two.  Came at 5 and was pleased to see more people in the restaurant than the last time we where here. Feels more comforting personally.    My partner ordered the non vegetarian Dahl thali **(that take out menu, in restaurant menu and online menu all have different items listed for this- be warned) **  which was a great way to try a lot of different items. They serve you small portions dishes, plus rice, naan and a yogurt dip. Such a great deal to try new food. The menu said dessert was part of it but it never came. Out of all the dishes the only one that he didn't like was the lentils. Was too salty. Not sure it that's how it's supposed to be or if it just got over seasoned.    I ordered whipped spinach with cheese, and goat curry at a spicy level of 7 andJeera Rice( if you never had this before, I HIGHLY recommend this)  and of course garlic naan. What came to the table was different. I got a different goat dish instead of the curry ( tomato base that was thin and soupy) and with very little spice. (My boyfriend order his spice lever at 5 and was stronger than my dishes)  new cook, different cook, waiter miss heard me??  I didn't complain because I hate that at restaurants and didn't want to waste the food. It was still good ( not amazing like last time but again, I got the wrong dish) different chef, off night?    No dessert for the boyfriend  I was served the wrong dish   I still really enjoy the food I was served and my evening out but these little things kind of bug me. the servers are always nice and great, sometimes a bit slow when trying to wrap things up at the end. I'm just gonna say it was a off night.   Of course I'll be back because everything is still delicious.

Reviews.Author: Waqas
Reviews.Content: Our first time eating here. Yelp's reviews brought us here :)    We had the manchurian veggie balls for an appetizer & chicken karadi with plain nans for dinner. Everything was delicous!  The staff were all very friendly & attentive.   Baby Alayna approves too :)  Btw the mango lassi was yummy too

Reviews.Author: Abha
Reviews.Content: The food here is amazing!  Loved the fresh hot naans and malai kofta.  We had our Thanksgiving family reunion here (I know - not traditional) and they were very polite and accommodating.  We were 27 people from 3 years old to 72 years old and we were a little rambunctious - mostly because all of us were trying to talk at once.  But the Delhi staff was polite and listened to each one of our requests and followed up promptly.  Highly recommend this place even though it is a bit off the Strip.  A few of us family members walked back to Paris Hotel after dinner and it was absolutely do-able.  Great hotel!  LOVED it!

Reviews.Author: Manveer
Reviews.Content: Buffet starts at 11 and we reached at 11:30. We were surprised food was cold already. Chicken biryani and chicken curry were really good, everything else was okayish. Service was good and very polite.

Reviews.Author: James
Reviews.Content: Hands down, the best Indian food in Las Vegas.  The buffet is incredible and economical.  Plus a free drink when you check in on Yelp!

Reviews.Author: Anusha
Reviews.Content: Best Indian food ever. We tired almost all Indian restaurants in and around Vegas and this is the outstanding one. Sumptuous food, warm welcoming, and quick service are their attractions... I recommend everyone to try food here when you visit Vegas

Reviews.Author: Susan
Reviews.Content: Came here recently and loved the buffet.  The nan was hot and fresh.  Tandori Chicken was as good as I have ever had.  I will certainly return to Delhi on my next trip to Las Vegas.

Reviews.Author: Lawrence
Reviews.Content: And the NEW Undisputed Indian Champ of LV is......Delhi  Just a week ago I went to another 4.5 star Indian Buffet off Sahara and there's no comparison - Delhi's so much better and I need to revisit Mint to see if it unseats it but I m pretty sure it does.  Their lunch buffet selection is ridiculous with Biriyani, Goat Cury, Chicken Curry, Tandori, and many other specialties.  They switch it up as I've been a few times and everything is done better than Mt Everest Indian.  The goat curry here had better flavor and was more tender.   When they bring you the naan, it's piping hot made to order chock full of garlic.  I went to play a poker tournament after and this definitely helped me force a couple folds.  They have a great check in deal where you get a free Lassi or soda - gotta go with the Mango Lassi.   I've yet to come for dinner but if their lunch buffet is this good i'm sure it will also deliver!

Reviews.Author: Susie
Reviews.Content: Okay so I just don't get the hype. I was really excited - I mean Indian, buffet, good reviews, sounds like a recipe for success. It was okay... and cheaper than other places at $9.99. But I think I would pay the extra few dollars and go a block over to Mint in a heart beat. Yes the buffet takes up length wise over half the restaurant, but what I didn't care for about this place was that it lacked variety - you have the standard Tandoori chicken, Tikka Masala etc.  But maybe it was a busy day before I got there giving them the benefit of the doubt, but I had to fish around in the sauce to find pieces of chicken and not only in the tikki masala but any dish which contained sauce and meat. Don't get me wrong I love sauce, but I like to find that there is ample meat to accompany my sauce.   Also, there was something about the ambience that felt cold - maybe it was the poor acoustics which made it feel very big and open but not in a good way or the just the set up but somehow the dining room was not overly inviting. Although, that in itself is not something that would normally concern me - hey if the food is superb I'll eat it sitting on a street corner (as used to be the case with Viva Las Arapas before they moved).
