Nonetheless, I thought it is something that should be noted.   Service was average, nothing outstanding. We did request garlic naan and they brought it. My friend asked for lemon wedges for water, they forgot, had to ask again and then they brought a plate of lime wedges from the salad bar.. maybe they don't have lemons?   On the upside I got a free Mango Lassi which was tasty with Yelp check in - so thank you Delhi Indian Cuisine for that treat. So overall I wish them good luck and I hope that they make it as I do with all restaurants that are not chains but unfortunately I am going to stay loyal to Mint for lunch buffet, and Mt. Everest as a second choice.

Reviews.Author: Madge
Reviews.Content: All VEGAN and VEGETARIAN  items are clearly marked. They have a meat section and a veggie section. The staff really care that you have a good experience. The manager named  Hari  is just AMAZING.  For lunch buffet it is fast and dependable. The quality is consistent from day to day...which is very good. For weekend Sunday is my favorite day to go. I eat a huge pile of noodles that are  asian-indian fusion  along with Samosas, Lentil Soup and what-ever else I can before I  pop . Yummy  UPDATE : Nov 6th just went there again today. It was great and fresh

Reviews.Author: Jillien
Reviews.Content: CANT BE BEAT!!! This is my all time fav place to eat in Vegas. Where else can you get a wide variety or veggie and meat selections in a takeout or dine in form?!?( serious question...let me know) I love Indian food and Dahl Indian Cuisine NEVER disappoints.

Reviews.Author: Christopher
Reviews.Content: Amazing Indian food! We went for dinner and their chicken tikka masala was so delicious along with their yummy garlic naan. Their goat vindaloo was just as amazing. Everything was great and the staff is very friendly! We also had the mango lassi and it was so tasty I want more! Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Author: Andrea
Reviews.Content: Four words: bang for your buck. For $9.00 you get amazing food! And when you're in Vegas surrounded by steak buffets offering powdered mashed potatoes, this is a great deal. What this place lacked in ambience, it made up for in taste. It's relatively new with a great culinary future ahead.  The owner was very sweet. He personally brought over the free mango lassi I got from checking in (delicious, might I add).  If you're feeling your pockets empty because the strip is just too darn expensive, then hop on over to the outskirts of main vegas attractions and scoop up your desired heaps of savory, succulent, mouth-watering (affordable) Indian food. Seriously though, go go go.

Reviews.Author: Renee
Reviews.Content: I've been looking for a really excellent Indian restaurant in Vegas for a while now, and this totally exceeded my expectations. This was my first time here, and they gave me complimentary rice with my (some type of curry? Alas, I forgot) dish. My significant other ordered a lamb-curry dealio and couldn't rave enough about it. This was his first time trying Indian food ever, so this was a pretty epic moment. There is a plethora of vegetarian options, of course, and the naan tasted uber hot and fresh and is friggin' delightful. 10/10 would Delhi again

Reviews.Author: Angel
Reviews.Content: I came here today 45 minutes before their lunch buffet closed and it was a good experience.   We were sat promptly as our party was already there. They have about 12 hot dishes that range from curries to rices and then a salad bar.  The stand outs were the chicken curry, goat curry, and the chicken tikka masala. They also gave our table two orders of garlic naan. The naan was piping hot and full of garlic.  I would say the amount of meat in the curries was minimal but given it was a buffet I understood. Plus the flavors of all of the curry dishes were each so delicious and unique that the sauce with naan was enough for me.  I'm used to having curry in a non AYCE setting and I don't know if I'll ever do that again. The value of the buffet was really good for the variety.  I also liked their fried onion fritters, the veggie samosas, and their rice and chicken dish. I don't know any of the names but everything was worth a try.  The staff was solid for a buffet as in those 45 minutes I had my drink refilled about 5 times. They also cleaned up our plates before I got back from each trip the buffet line  They also had this spice mix when you leave up front that was full of spices they used like dinner mints which was cool to try.  I like the value, the restaurant staff, the decor, and definitely the flavors. For $35 after tax for three people it's an excellent value and I'll return very soon.  Chicken tikka masala that is comparable is about $15 at most establishments on its on so this was awesome.

Reviews.Author: Devika
Reviews.Content: Great buffet! Good service.. Chicken curry, naan, veg curry, chicken biryani, tandoori, all was delicious. The ending with Gajar halva was heaven. We got a good chai to end our lunch. The price is good for the amount, service, variety in flavors & taste.

Reviews.Author: LIB
Reviews.Content: I rarely go to a place that lands 5 stars in all aspects.  Great food, great price $10.99, good service! Ooof! I'm stuffed.  Highly recommend this place.

Reviews.Author: Srikanth
Reviews.Content: Excellent food and service! Ordered yellow dhal, chole and bhindi masala. It was outstanding. Would strongly recommend this place

Reviews.Author: Jeremy
Reviews.Content: Simply the best service! So friendly and sincere & the food was too notch. I was so excited I forgot to take a picture of the presentation but it least I took one of the aftermath..... So good I couldn't finish it all. I will be back for sure and will mark this as one of my favorite spots.

Reviews.Author: Steven
Reviews.Content: Delhi Indian Cuisine, you have become my favorite!  I went a few weeks ago for the buffet, and as buffet goes I think this one is one of the stand outs.  I loved each curry I tried, where in alot of places flavor does not separate  each dish. But for each choice at Delhi Indian Cuisine, I could taste a different recipe.  I also had the mango lassie.  It helped anytime i had a super spicy curry.  The only downside was that it was such a small glass. Honestly I would drink a gallon of lassie if they served it to me.  The selection was great, I really though the naan and the tandori chicken was the best I have had in a while.  And to finish off a perfect buffet lunch, the mango custard was amazing.  I will be back.  And I can't wait to take my friends.

Reviews.Author: Irene
Reviews.Content: I love Indian food and I've been to several Indian restaurants on and off the strip so I was very delighted when my friend told me of Delhi's Indian buffet. I'm usually a little disappointed with the small portions at the Indian restaurants so I thought the buffet would be a good change.   I was very very pleased with my experience. The selection was great and the food tasted very good. I haven't had vegetable pakoras that tasted as good as the ones they serve here. I tried goat curry for the first time and was impressed. The chicken tandoori and chicken biryani were just as delicious. I also tried these dough balls in syrup called Gulab Jamun and although the texture was a little weird at first the flavor was exceptional. The server suggested I try it with the rice pudding and it tasted even better!   I have nothing but positive things to say about this place. The service was prompt and friendly and you cannot beat the price of $9.99! My bf said we're not going anywhere else for Indian food. We have definitely found a gem!

Reviews.Author: Mohammed
Reviews.Content: Food taste was average, tasty but not special. Staff were friendly. We ordered our food medium spicy but it came out very spicy.

Reviews.Author: Pratyusha
Reviews.Content: Very less vegetarian options in the buffet. Was not a great fan of the place and food.

Reviews.Author: Hernani
Reviews.Content: Great Food!!! You won't be disappointed. My favorites are the chicken Biryani and Chicken Curry. Love the flavor and spice. Great atmosphere and ambience. I will definitely come back for more.

Reviews.Author: Sarah
Reviews.Content: Food was delicious! Owner was super nice too! He came and talked to us and even offered me and my friend free mango dessert drinks~!   They have a great selection in the buffet and you can't beat the price!   I'll definitely return ~ And I highly recommend this place.

Reviews.Author: Christopher
Reviews.Content: (Review of buffet only)  Interesting choice of location to set up a new Indian buffet on the east side of town considering you have Mint, India Masala, Origin India, Gandhi, and Taste of India all within a 2 mile radius, although I think it's the others that should be intimidated, since the new kid in town has got some bhangra swagger.  Pretty much all of its rivals are in little strip malls of varying degrees of  decay, so this should not deter you in terms of its exterior.  Once you step inside, the modern decor with track lighting, single open room layout, and seemingly endless linear display of offerings along the buffet line should set your mind at ease.    Upon being seated, you are immediately prompted if you would like naan bread with your buffet.  Not only should you say yes, but you should specifically request the garlic naan since the aroma alone with the freshly minced garlic and finishing brush of ghee emanating from the freshly cut bread removed from the tandoori oven is intoxicating enough to get your appetite revved up on the feast that lies ahead (refills are complimentary if you need more)  As one approaches the buffet line, the first wave of offerings include various meats including the standards such tandoori, tikki masala, and curry chicken along with some wild cards such as goat curry and reshmi kababs, which is a ground chicken meatball that seems a bit healthier than the sauced meats.   The latter half of the line offers a multitude of vegetarian offerings including saag paneer (spinach), chana masala (spicy stewed chickpeas), eggplant, mixed curry veggies, and lentils.  The third category of offerings is the carbs, which in this case included plain basmati, a spicy chicken biryani, mini-samosas (which gives you more of the flaky crust to enjoy, much like why mini-pecan pies are superior to regular pecan pie), idli (a steamed rice cake), and something I've never seen before, a spongy savory cake called dhokla, which I've read to be a beloved street snack in the southern part of India.  It has a cornbread-like consistency, a rich yellow hue from turmeric and mustard seeds, and is served with some chili peppers, cilantro, and toasted coriander seeds.  Add a dollop of tamarind, and it is a pretty addictive combo of flavors which I would have had more of had I not discovered it at the end of my meal.    I almost never have room for desserts after an Indian buffet but it is a rotating mix of gulab jamun(sweet milk balls), rice pudding, gajar halwa (carrots+milk), and a few offerings of fruit which I am always a bit wary of when it comes to buffets in general.    Service was very good in which plates were cleared and water was refilled efficiently, and the staff checked in a few times to see how I was enjoying the meal.  Compared to the local competition, price point is excellent (9.99 vs 10.99 at India Masala, and 12 and up at Mint and Gandhi), quality of food is definitely in my top 3 in Vegas (Mount Everest and Taj Palace), and highlights include the garlic naan, balance in offerings between vegetarian and meat dishes,  a few unique offerings (mini samosas and dhokla), and ambiance.  India Masala is still my go-to choice for take out buffet due to quantity (refer to my review for my patented packing technique) as well as complimentary Mango Lassi with yelp check-in, but if I'm dining in, Delhi Indian is my new go-to place for quality when I plan to go on an Indian carb feeding frenzy for lunch.

Reviews.Author: Tyler
Reviews.Content: This place truly surprised me. I took advice from a fellow Eliter on this place. I'm totally glad I did. I'm totally not one for Buffets but this place had really fresh food. None of the food tasted like it's been sitting there a while. A lot of buffets run into that problem.   Lunch buffet was all you can eat for $9.99. Great deal!  Restaurant was big and spacious so you aren't on top of one another. Service is meh. The servers really don't know the food too well. I was quite nervous eating there because I have a tomato allergy. Server didn't know the sauces too well so I had to be selective on what to eat. Sucks but at least I was smart in my food picking. I asked the server what was in the sauce like spices and such and all he kept saying was  it's cream based  over and over. Like I get that but what else is in it???? At least go ask a manager or a cook?!  Malai Kofti (fried vegetable balls in sauce) was my favorite part of the meal. A sauce unlike I have had in a while with yummy fried veggies in it. All around amazing.  The vegetable Samosa I expected more. The flaky part was ok but the vegetable middle wasn't what I was expecting: I just dipped it in the Malai Kofti sauce and it tasted better lol  Basmati rice was simple like most places. Hard to mess up. Mixed it with some goat stew and it came out great.   GIVE THIS PLACE A TRY YOU WILL BE PLEASANTLY SURPRISED.

Reviews.Author: Michelle
Reviews.Content: Was a little disappointed that the buffet was only available at lunch, that said the food we ordered was reasonably priced and the quality was comparable to our favorite places back home. Located in a small shopping plaza, it was pretty empty when our party of 7 arrived so no problems with seating. Later more families came, predominantly Indian which is always a sign of authenticity. The goat curry was fantastic. They had a wide variety of lassis including strawberry, cherry and lychee which the kids enjoyed. We ordered all of the dishes mild for the picky eaters in our group but I was happy to find that some dishes were more on the spicy side. Usually have to order extra rice and naan but the portions here were good sized and ended up with leftovers. The manager was very friendly and helpful and came to our table many times to check up on us. I had ordered a gulab jamun to go and was pleasantly surprised later when he doubled my order for free. Everyone was very happy with the food and the service. Will visit again next time we are in Vegas.

Reviews.Author: Lynhdan
Reviews.Content: Fantastic Indian cuisine. We had the butter chicken, dal and lamb koma and the flavors and texture was right on point.

Reviews.Author: Mona
Reviews.Content: As an Indian lunch buffet veteran in Seattle/ NYC/ Chicago, I was very impressed with the variety and quality of dishes offered for the price. The goat curry was a standout, as well as, the gajar halwah dessert, drizzled with some rice pudding, as a sauce.  I would definitely return with friends on my next visit to Las Vegas.

Reviews.Author: Karsten
Reviews.Content: The very best food we have had in Las Vegas. Very tasty, adequate spiced and nice served.  All staff was friendly, smiling and with a sense of humor. This was not our last visit!

Reviews.Author: Zachary
Reviews.Content: Very clean.  Friendly staff.  Food tastes great.  All this for 9.99.  We'll be back over and over again.  Dont forget to try the garlic naan.

Reviews.Author: Saravana Prabhu
Reviews.Content: One of the good Indian restaurants in Vegas. Good food and descently priced. Lunch buffet was really good.

Reviews.Author: Stephany
Reviews.Content: Great service! Good food! The reason I am giving four stars is because it did take a long time for the food to come out. Granted we were warned ahead of time, so at least we prepared ourselves for the long wait.

Reviews.Author: Heather
Reviews.Content: I rarely eat Indian food, so I took an opportunity to come here for dinner while my kitchen was out of order and I had some shopping to do nearby. Some friends recommended this place, but didn't give any specifics on what to order. I tried the Delhi vegetarian thali- a sampler of curry dishes served with naan, rice, and samosas. Everything was good- and the presentation was quite nice. My favorites were the malai kofta and dal makhani. I also ordered the mango chutney, but didn't love it. The Thali says for one person only, but I left very full without touching the rice. The staff checked up on me often- maybe because business was slow. I would come back, maybe to try some new things or to check out the lunch buffet.

Reviews.Author: Cyril
Reviews.Content: Unassuming and amazingly delicious. If you like Indian and Nepalese food you gotta try it.

Reviews.Author: S
Reviews.Content: After a long time found a typical North Indian restaurant which still has some true Indian flavors in their chicken, goat curries and creamy tikka masala  Pakora, tandoori , were good too.   Biryani was decent  Chilli chicken could have been better.   Could probably improve their sambar.

Reviews.Author: Keivan
Reviews.Content: Great Indian food and it's made fresh to order. Best lamb biryani I had so far (comparing to bay area and Chicago)

Reviews.Author: Sharath
Reviews.Content: We visited the restaurant for an afternoon buffet and found that the appetizers options were adequate but the entree and dessert options were less and also did not look to be fresh considering that we were there around 1 PM and not at 3 PM which is what the restaurant serves buffet until.

Reviews.Author: Anupkumar
Reviews.Content: Pathetic service..!!! Waste of time.. please don't visit...we r waiting for food last more than 1 n half hour ..

Reviews.Author: Roxanne
Reviews.Content: I love Indian food, definitely a favorite cuisine for me. I keep coming back to Delhi and its becoming my new favorite indian restaurant in town.   It seems this place must do the majority of business during their lunch buffet because each time we have dined in the evening it's been dead. I don't mind a quiet restaurant...actually I prefer to feel like I have a restaurant all to my self but it makes me worried that somehow this restaurant is hurting. I hope not! I would hate to see another great Indian restaurant close.   The service here is great, the owner is always floating around and managing every aspect. You can tell he is passionate about his restaurant and it really shines through the service and food.   The Food  Chicken Tikka Masala Amazing. Perfect balance of cream, tomato and masala spices. Not too oily and great depth of flavor. Chicken is succulent and juicy, only gripe is there is not enough chicken but I deal with it because their sauce is that good.  Naan Airy pockets with doughy edges and just the perfect amount of seasonings. Heavenly! Always so fresh and so darn addicting and their garlic version is a standout.   Tandoori  Have tried both chicken and shrimp. By far my favorite was the shrimp. I've always preferred a shrimp tandoori anyway because there is nothing more visually appetizing than large juicy shrimp and fresh onions and lemons sitting atop a sizzling hot plate. Those sexy soft hissing and popping noises get me every time.    Matter Paneer  Well I have had better IMO but it wasn't bad. I think it's too forward with tomato and I'm searching for more creamy notes. Which is silly when you think about it, there is paneer in there and that should somehow be enough, maybe a touch more cream would make it better? I don't know.   Malai kofta  Sauce 10! Dumplings 0! Way too dense and I like when they are shaped into round balls instead of those football shaped things. I'm totally just whining here, shape shouldn't matter but the shape coupled with how dense they were just didn't do it for me. But that sauce though! Their cashew based sauces are amazing.   Gulab Jamun Again another too dense item but I don't hold that against them. I've experienced the same dense issue at other restaurants regarding this dessert. Maybe was cooked or sitting too long? Not sure.  Mango lassi Dare I say this was made with canned mango? I hope I'm wrong here but I'm pretty sure it wasn't fresh mango. Still tasty nonetheless especially as the alcoholic version.   All in all this place is excellent. Great dishes full of flavor and wonderful attentive service. I can't really ask for more!

Reviews.Author: Jay
Reviews.Content: This is my new favorite Indian Buffet!!  Lots of choices! All fresh, hot and great spice.  People were nice and attentive.  If I had one thing negative to say it would be that it is hot and humid in the dining room. However, it's so good I don't mind sweating.   This is my second time now and it is better than I remember.   The food is wonderful and it is not hot or humid.  Just perfect.

Reviews.Author: Jonathan
Reviews.Content: What can I say? This place is not what I was expecting. Taking my first step into the door I was in awh. Upon entrance my friend and I were greeted and shown to our table where our third party was waiting for us. The slightest details of this place were excellent; The booths were nice and comfortable, The ceiling lights: modern, The music sets the mood: calm and relaxing.  The customer service was great; because the three of us we're foreign to Indian Cuisine we had many question on what we were eating. The staff was very knowledgeable and able to answer our every question.   The food? It was delicious!! No complaints on my end. The Butter Chicken was very well rounded. Nice and creamy curry, soft and moist chicken; put that on top of rice and you get a wombo combo! The complimentary Papadum was something else: the bread was nice and crispy, add one of the two sauces that came on the side and you get a sweet taste (black sauce) or a earthy savory taste (green sauce). We also ordered the Sev Puri which was a whole mouth full of flavor. The house made cracker was nice and crispy topped off with what seemed to be a jumbled yet organized mess of toppings and you get a nice high note of sour and spicy and a slight saltiness. The visual representation and organization of these dish depicts what hard work the chef puts into the food before it is delivered to the customers table.  Overall I would highly recommend this place to anyone looking forward to experience new flavors. Great staff. Great food. You can't ask for anything more except for food.

Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: Best Indian food ever .   EVER.      Goat curry is good.    Chicken curry no bones is good.  And everything is good.   But mango lassi looked reddish.      Too much food coloring?   But it was good too

Reviews.Author: Mia
Reviews.Content: Delicious fresh food! Best Indian food in Vegas. Place is very clean. Customer service is prompt and friendly. I was not expecting the food to be this good. I highly recommend this place!!

Reviews.Author: Merri
Reviews.Content: Super great food and it was a buffet.  Really yummy and a variety of foods to try.  Great location

Reviews.Author: Anna
Reviews.Content: I've constantly been disappointed with Indian food in the US, but this place is awesome! I ate way too much, but it was just so good that I couldn't stop. I would definitely go back if we weren't leaving Vegas tomorrow morning.

Reviews.Author: Praneeth
Reviews.Content: So far from my experience best restaurant in Vegas,  although I am a vegetarian so only can comment on Veg food. Their manchurian and momo's are best. Also restaurant is Spacious so no waiting..!!! I wish they add dosas to menu and veg biryani in buffet.

Reviews.Author: Ashwin
Reviews.Content: Food is really good and very nice waitress...Restaurant is very spacious  and try Lassi...Sambar is very tasty.

Reviews.Author: LN
Reviews.Content: Tried their buffet lunch for the first time.  After tax, it's works out for $25 for two, which is amazing deal, considering all the food you get.   The buffet has three sections, two for hot entrees and one for fruit/veggies/dessert.  Everything tasted fresh and was delicious.  Servers were attentive and a manager came over to ask how everything was and if we needed anything.  Definitely recommend.

Reviews.Author: Betty
Reviews.Content: Great food and great service. The staff was very helpful and the garlic naan was delicious!  We will definitely be coming back!

Reviews.Author: Patrick
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to step out of our respective offices the other day for a quick lunch and this was the spot of choice.  And what a great choice it was!! They have a buffet style lunch with all kinds of great dishes for just $10.99.  I tried a little bit of everything, including my favorite aloo gobi. It was all delicious.  Literally nothing on the buffet I didn't like. The garlic naan was great too. Service was fast and efficient, and our drinks never ran dry.  We were in and out quickly, with tummies full to polish off the rest of the work day. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Author: Lee
Reviews.Content: Came here with my husband and we both loved it! The best Indian food I've had in years! Everything that interested me was tasty and also for my husband. I would highly recommend the buffet which is what we had! Great service, great food!

Reviews.Author: Mohammad
Reviews.Content: I went there a few days ago with a friend. I tried some of their vegetables and they were average. The lady said it's halal but i highly doubt it since alot of people disagreed. Other then that the staff was friendly

Reviews.Author: Maulik
Reviews.Content: I went with  la carte option, the food was good, but they took a lot of time in serving. If you take it positively, may be a good sign that they were cooking fresh food! I found it little expensive, though.

Reviews.Author: Vasanthan
Reviews.Content: Very good food. We came here as Mint restaurant was running full but felt very happy as food was very good here as well.

Reviews.Author: Robert
Reviews.Content: I come here for the perfectly seasoned and cooked goat curry, but all of the many items are great. It's not far from the strip, but it's mostly a locals spot. It's affordable priced and they offer free Naan. DIC is always busy but has plenty of space.

Reviews.Author: Negar
Reviews.Content: It has Delicious and cheap food! The only problem is it seems it is a business family. So in the rush hour time, you won't get good service.

Reviews.Author: Rob
Reviews.Content: Where shall I begin, food is excellent, nice atmosphere, service is great. The staff is very friendly and informative for first timers to Indian cuisine. The chicken tikka masala was my favorite dish, along with the yellow fried rice.

Reviews.Author: Nathan
Reviews.Content: I've just recently gotten into Indian food so I can't really compare it to more than 3 other places but man this place is so good. People are super nice and veg and non-vegetarian is all amazing. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Author: Azeem
Reviews.Content: Chicken Fried rice was bad.  Jeera rice is like it came out of ghee pot.   White rice n goat curry were good.  Ambiance is great

Reviews.Author: Anahi
Reviews.Content: Went for dinner, it was delicious! I had the Vegetarian Thali and my babe had the Butter Chicken. My Thali came with regular naan but we ordered additional garlic naan and both were tasty. We had plenty of leftovers, there was so much food! Service was great, really friendly.

Reviews.Author: Lynn
Reviews.Content: The food was seasoned right and I asked for mild and that's what I got. Lol. There wasn't a lot of people there when we arrived around 6:30 pm for dinner. It was little pricey, but portions was adequate. We were advised to come in for the buffet and have to same items we ordered and more at a great cost. The manager is nice and kind of a flirt or maybe he was pulling my leg. Lol. The staff was attentive and friendly.  We left a nice tip. We will be going back.

Reviews.Author: Consuella
Reviews.Content: Last night, my mother and I stopped in for dinner. We ordered garlic nan bread, tandoori chicken, & a mild curry chicken. The curry chicken was very good, but the Tandoori chicken, not so much. We never received refills on our drinks, the service was okay at best, and when we asked for for more rice, we were told no! But here's the kicker, we were never thanked nor did anyone say goodbye as we were walking out the door. Maybe the buffet during the day would be a better option since you're serving yourself.

Reviews.Author: Amy
Reviews.Content: Very good food. Nice atmosphere and friendly servers. The garlic naan is so good I took some home. Chicken tikka masala was excellent. Veggie samosa is very good and an excellent light meal. I can't wait to try everything on this large menu; everything is so tasty! The room while large was fairly quiet and the booths afford some privacy. I havent tried the buffet but will be back soon to do so!

Reviews.Author: P
Reviews.Content: Can't give minus stars, so starting with one star.  This is my first review ever and thought it might be helpful for anybody walking in with family and small hungry kids.  Service was so poor that one of the starters (chicken soup) was delivered after 35 min and the other starter (Pani Puri) after 40 min. Not to mention that the Pani puri shells were stale and smelled/tasted bad.  Food was delivered after one hour and don't even want to discuss how it was.  One of the servers realized and offered us gulab jamun, appreciate that, but fact is fact and if you are hungry and with impatient kids, please look somewhere else.

Reviews.Author: Maureen
Reviews.Content: I'd like to give them 3.5 stars, but it's not an option on reviews.  My stepdaughter and I ordered takeout from Bite LV. (Good service from them as an aside.)  The food was good quality.  We shared chicken tikka masala, butter chicken, garlic naan and samosas.  We like Indian food on the mild side.  The food tasted good and it was hot and delivered quickly.  My personal preference leans toward India Palace.  I find their food more flavorful, but In fairness, we order the food on the low scale of spicy.  I order the food the same way from IP but find it to be more to our liking.

Reviews.Author: Linda
Reviews.Content: One of the best Indian restaurants I've eaten at. We were here last year and couldn't remember the name. Literally drove by all the Indian restaurants in the area until we found it. Worth the effort!

Reviews.Author: Darrell
Reviews.Content: Well they have a buffet so food is plentiful, but, one of the dishes is goat curry. I guess I am not cool enough to eat that and as far as pans go it was the fullest, timing perhaps but I was told people like it. Place is clean and all the staff is very nice, love the bread.

Reviews.Author: Aalay
Reviews.Content: Best Indian buffet in Vegas!!! Lot of good vegetarian options and lot of sweets!!! The best thing was idli sambhar!! Must visit!!

Reviews.Author: James
Reviews.Content: Great meal. Nice people great tradition Indian cuisine. Garlic Naan was perfect. Curry Goat and the sizzling platter was just what was needed. If ur in the mood for Indian food this is the place.

Reviews.Author: Christen
Reviews.Content: BEST INDIAN FOOD IN VEGAS! I usually say all Indian food is delicious since I love it so much, but this is definitely the best (next to home made) that I've had. The prices are affordable, the location is clean and the service is fast.  We usually do take out, which I love, because the serving sizes are large. I love bringing the food home and binge watching House of Cards (or anything on Netflix). Add candlelight and the sound of rain falling outside your open window...makes for a romantic night in. Love it!

Reviews.Author: Christine
Reviews.Content: This place has great food for the price (lunch buffet).  It is not a disappointment either on selection.  They actually had one of my favorites which have been difficult to find in a buffet, vegetable samosa...very yummy.  Unlike a lot of Indian places, the food was not too salty.  Definitely will be a repeat customer.

Reviews.Author: Bala
Reviews.Content: Excellent Food with Authentic Taste and flavorful...Service was also fantastic. Mango Lassi is an absolute must have in this restaurant and one of the best that I have had ever. I had the Vegetarian Thali and every item was great..

Reviews.Author: Bill
Reviews.Content: Wow! First time here and all I have to say is wow! The food is fantastic!! This may be one of my new favorites. Hint: order the garlic naan, you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Author: Stephanie
Reviews.Content: Oh garlic naan! How I love you!  This place has legit naan! We came to the lunch buffet, the price went up from 9.99 to 10.99, but you get a free mango lassi with Yelp check-in.  Being that I'm a weirdo and I don't try everything, this was momentous for me. The inside was really dimly lit and clean clean. The buffet line was clean and the food didn't look hella old. It actually looked and smelled appetizing.   My person favorites were Tandoori chicken, chicken curry and butter chicken (that's what my coworker Safi said it was called) I was super impressed by everything! The customer service was great; the food was delicious and hot. For desert we had Gajar Ka Halwaw, my coworker loves this stuff!  We will be back! Yay!

Reviews.Author: Yoosef
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best Indian restaurants you can find in Vegas! I was here when it opened about 2 years ago, and it wasn't known that much! This restaurant has a variety of food that's good for both vegetarians and non-vegetarian! You can tell it's a great restaurant by looking at the crowd that come to the buffet!

Reviews.Author: Kailey
Reviews.Content: Excellent lunch buffet. Chicken biriyani, garlic naan, and chicken makhani are what I would recommend. Everything is good though. Cheap and reasonable price, can't go wrong with that. I hope this place gets more business.

Reviews.Author: Rishabh
Reviews.Content: i wish i could rate more but i cant. i was there on saturday for dinner and then later on sunday for lunch buffet. Before i start i would like to say that i am vegetarian and i am only saying from this perspective. when we were there on Saturday for dinner it was nice and comforting everything was on point so we decided to return today for lunch buffet! But no it was a wrong choice this time. It is the worst buffet that i ever had in US. the food waa not fresh and it tastes pathetic.  sambar was as thick as a gravy of shahi paneer, punjabi kadi was as sour as lemon and it is super thick too with no dumplings in it.  then we tried kofta and its same no taste: very thich and same with yellow daal. BTW there were few more (aloo matar,corn saag) and they were equally horrible. we ordered breads and they were also not properly cooked we have to ask our server to cook it properly. Mind it we didnt had any trouble yesterday over the dinner. When we informed about our disappointed to the management they started giving diffuse excuses and just said sorry!  i dont think the sorry was sincere !  i have grew in delhi and i know how the delhi food tastes! i am not returning back again and will not advise anyone!

Reviews.Author: Tiffany
Reviews.Content: This buffet was amazing! This is the first time I've been here and I was impressed with the variety and freshness of the food. The curry chicken and the chicken tandoori were especially delicious. As a lover of spicy foods, this buffet was right up my alley.  The price was reasonable, considering the quality of the food and the atmosphere of the dining area. They do have gluten free/vegan/vegetarian options as well. Overall, 5 stars for a great dining experience.

Reviews.Author: Lisamarie
Reviews.Content: You know it's legit when you're the only white person in the restaurant. This is officially the greatest tasting Indian food I have EVER experienced in my life! Thank you YELP for leading me here.  Only down fall is how well they're doing. This place is so packed that they are having trouble keeping their buffet filled. The naan is instantly gone once it's put out/served.

Reviews.Author: Ben
Reviews.Content: We had to get off the strip for a little, and we wanted some Indian food for lunch. This hit the price point and the relaxed environment we were looking for.  I thought it was a good price for the quality and selection. I thought the Curry Chicken and Butter Chicken could have used a deeper flavor, but all of it was pretty tasty. The Chicken Tandoori was pretty dried out so that would be the only dish I recommend skipping.  The Garlic naan was made fresh whenever you ran out and was very good.  If you are vegetarian the buffet gets even better for you. They had a number of choices that were flavorful. Paleek Paneer is a personal favorite.

Reviews.Author: Denis
Reviews.Content: I have been to 4 other Indian buffets in Vegas but none of them made me crave their food as badly as this place.   The service here is not always the best but it's getting better in recent months. You may need to wait a little longer to get their attention especially if you don't look Indian. I don't really care because their food compensates for everything else.   My favorite buffet dish is Malai Kofta. Just dip your fresh naan bread in it and you will know what I mean. Kebabs are also really good.   They tend to rotate their buffet dishes throughout the week but removing Malai Kofta on certain days is the crime against the part of humanity they made addicted to it!

Reviews.Author: Brittany
Reviews.Content: The best service I've ever received at a restaurant. And delicious food! Please go!   We came for a late dinner, stayed past closing, and received freshly made, free desserts. Not to mention outstanding service throughout.   Each dish was absolutely excellent, and SO FRESH. Our friend ordered the tandoori chicken and loved it. It had few spices, came out on a sizzling hot plate; great for anyone scared of eating Indian.   Recommend the chick pea bread, rice pudding, and carrot desserts.  Couldn't say anything better. (Thank you!)

Reviews.Author: Sri
Reviews.Content: Very creepy servers ,always looking on what are we eating.horrible taste and not delicious. Will not recommend for desi people anytime.

Reviews.Author: Luciana
Reviews.Content: I went there for the first time and I really like the goat. And the Biryani . Friendly staff. Chicken kebab was very good. It's halal !!!

Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: This is only my second Indian buffet I've tried, so maybe you want to take that into consideration. But I'd come back again. A great deal for only $11/person. They had butter chicken and goat curry, which were both good and not tough or overly dry. The veggie/salad section was small but fresh. Chana masala and potatoes/cauliflower mixture were good. (Unfortunately for me) they had more of a vegetarian selection than meat selection. But all in all, a decent variety to suit any palate or diet. One plate was enough for me as I find Indian food to be extremely filling, even in small quantities.  A few minor complaints were that the naan was thin in some parts, but very doughy towards the middle. And had to remind one of the workers about my drink order. But worth it to come back again.

Reviews.Author: Krish
Reviews.Content: First time food here love chicken Briyani love service and food thanks I will be back for sure thanks you guys for the wonderful food

Reviews.Author: Charlotte
Reviews.Content: My husband and I love good Indian curry.  In fact, most times we prefer to cook at home rather than going out.  Enter Dehli.  They have an awesome lunch buffet that has a lot of curries that are difficult to make at home.  Overall, go to this place for lunch and order the Garlic Naan

Reviews.Author: Henry
Reviews.Content: What a great spot for AYCE Indian buffet for brunch on the weekend! You get a lot of different varieties here to suits your craving.  The service I received from the staff are always friendly and top notch that I don't hesitate to leave them a fat tip afterward.    Please keep up the excellent work and I will continue to show my support in the future!

Reviews.Author: Anum
Reviews.Content: After reading so many reviews, my BF and I finally tried this place out last week. We had the lunch buffet, and I was surprised by the variety of the different foods. Of course our first question to the owner was if the meat is halal or not, and it was!! *halal alert*   The food was delicious, everything from the reshmi kabob to the warm gajar ka halwa. They had chicken tandoori (flavorful!), goat biryani, channa masala, and the list can keep going on and on. We also ordered garlic naan (including in the 10$ buffet price) and it honestly seemed to come right out of the oven! I couldn't get enough of the chicken tikka masala, and the Navrata korma (I think that's the name? LOL). The sauce (Salan) was creamy and hot.   It became obvious that this place is going to be very popular VERY soon. We talked to the owner, and he was very helpful. He told us that although the main items stay the same during the lunch buffet, sometimes the dessert (mithai) might change, and maybe the lentil curry (daal).   The atmosphere of the restaurant was quite fancy and quiet on the day that we went... But they have a very nice setup.   I'm itching to come back again! :)   SPECTACULAR place!! MUST GO.

Reviews.Author: Jacqueline
Reviews.Content: Excellent service and very tasty goat curry. Garlic naan was slightly biter but the Mango Lassi and chai were great.

Reviews.Author: Ia Faye
Reviews.Content: It's a place that's a little out of the way (really close to UNLV tho) and if you're looking for authentic Indian food this is a great place to visit. It's a buffet, but the selection is on the small side. They DO however have Butter Chicken, which I found is something that a lot of Indian restaurants in Vegas lack (that has saddened me to no end, Butter Chicken and I are in a committed relationship). There are two sides to the buffet; one side is purely vegetarian which is nice so people don't get confused. The food itself is really delicious. I ate almost everything and I recommend it all. I also recommend getting a Mango Lassi if you're not good at handling spice. Since the food isn't made to order, you have no control over the spice levels.

Reviews.Author: C
Reviews.Content: Having a delicious lunch before I go into work!  Started my lunch off with a free mango lassi! Check in on yelp for a free mango lassi or soda!  So yummy! Always great service too!

Reviews.Author: Varun
Reviews.Content: I have never imagined that I would get such a great Indian vegetarian food in Vegas. This is a great place for any vegetarian folks out there in Vegas, especially this restaurant serves Jain( food without onion, potatoes and garlic). The staff is very friendly and helping. I would recommend to visits this place if you're looking for delicious Indian food and great ambience. Totally worth it.

Reviews.Author: Romanii
Reviews.Content: Curry was good. Lachha Paratha was not even close to what it is supposed to be...  Paneer Paratha had raw paneer (no masala, etc).... And in a delivery order to Hotel there were no disposable plastic ware or napkins.  One star deduction for each issue:-(

Reviews.Author: Siddharth
Reviews.Content: This is a famed restaurant in Las Vegas,  Went for buffet yesterday with family. Extremely disappointed. Food was OK at best. Tandoori chicken was cold and dry, It got finished and was not replenished for 30 mins. Till then we were done. They serve bread (naan) fresh on the table. Great. We were 4 adults. Gave us 2 naans, one garlic and one plain. We didn't know the type till we were done with the top garlic one. We asked for another garlic naan and our unfriendly waitress refused till we finished all the naans. As is in dictatorship you have to follow what the Govt says so here we have to obey with the instructions. When done, we asked for Garlic naan and for a change she smiled and left to get replenishment. We waited for as long as we could reminding her but with little success. Finally after a long wait we got the naan (1 piece) only to discover that it was not properly cooked and raw dough was coming in our mouth. Called the waitress and she quickly took our naan away never to be seen again. At that point we were disappointed and done. Paid our bill and left the place vowing to never return.  My wife paid the bill as me and kids were freaking out because of poor quality of management and lack of food. She complained to the manager who had following reasons. Got too many people, staff ran away, 3 weeks ago there was rain in Las Vegas that they are recovering from etc.. However we had to pay full price for the food while they all messed up. Our waitress was very unprofessional and would run away when before we could finish asking her a question. I had once asked her to listen patiently. She was rude or may be helpless. Did not understand hospitality and maybe had no experience. I think if she was polite my review would not be so negative. As I see we paid full price for below average meal and horrible service. Will not go there again.

Reviews.Author: bry
Reviews.Content: i like their selections..from curries and vegetables! this is a hidden indian food away from the strip

Reviews.Author: Shawna
Reviews.Content: Real exceptional service... Attentive and kind and the food was phenom!  Big fan of super spicy food and they did it right :). palaak paneer was perfect and great portions too.  Will be back :). Thanks!

Reviews.Author: Lee
Reviews.Content: Excellent. Food was spicy and well prepared. Atmosphere was nice. The place was extremely clean. I'll definitely be back.

Reviews.Author: Carol
Reviews.Content: I am a self confessed foodie! I am in particular an Indian food snob!  I have the opportunity to travel with my job and I try ask sorts of locally owned places. Because this place received a good review I thought I'd give it a go... Oh man! Wonderful! The Saag paneer was fantastic. As was everything I tried. Everything was fresh and flavorful. I easy Indian all over the state's and this it's by far the best I've had! I'm almost sorry I only make it to Vegas twice a year!

Reviews.Author: Stefany
Reviews.Content: Solid lunch buffet for $11/person- clean and organized display with all item labeled, naan available by request with garlic, and free mango lassi with Yelp check-in.  Cucumber, onion, and tamarind-sauce salad is refreshing and delicious. Goat curry is meaty with good heat to it, tandoori chicken, curry chicken, chili chicken, and biryani rice all available. Vegetarian options included samosas, pekora, chana masala, dal, and squash, along with saag paneer. The salad section also has a phenomenal mint sauce that goes deliciously with absolutely everything- I'd buy this stuff to go if I could (I didn't ask). Finished up with the gulab jamun, my favorite dessert of milk-cheese balls soaked in honey sauce.  I liked that the variety of the buffet was fairly diverse with a lot of lighter and vegetarian options, allowing me to sample a little of everything without totally pigging out. Service was polite and soft-spoken, we were asked repeatedly if we liked our food, which was appreciated.  Having moved here from the Bay area, with about 234920349 times more Indian restaurant options to pick from, I simply wish I didn't have to cross town to find this cuisine.

Reviews.Author: Allison
Reviews.Content: Very tasty food... not a very large selection but good for the buffet i guess.  the service was very very slow.  took almost 20 min to get the bread which is essential in eating indian food!  place wasnt even busy. we must have asked the waitress at least 4 times and she just kept forgetting.  all in all it was good....

Reviews.Author: Jose
Reviews.Content: Great buffet, service is great, good food for the money cant go wrong with this place

Reviews.Author: Anayeli
Reviews.Content: Best Indian food !!! Love chill chicken  and okra dish with mango lassi . Don't forget to get some garlic naans !!

Reviews.Author: Haseeb
Reviews.Content: One of the best buffets in vegas taste real desi and reasonable staff is nice ,i love the environment must try nice. Cheers!

Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: Just thinking about the place made me hungry .It`s 11 PM so probably too late for the buffet .But anyway ,Vegas local ,frequent visitor to the Indian buffet and have been to most in town .Yes that crazy ! I started going to this place about 2 months ago , had a gigantic biryani and mango lassi , the chef specializes in the Mango lassi as far as I am concerned! Fan ever since . First time I went there for the buffet , the garlic bread , the mushroom were fantastic , not to mention the chicken and mutton .I had a feast , no pun intended . Only regret that day was, maybe  I shouldn`t have eaten that much .But by another 3 days the regret vanished and i duly returned ,this time ,they had another special variety of chicken , I am blanking on the name , but i was good , if you end up there just look and sausage like chicken roll,it`s really good .  When I am not going to this one ,I am probably going to some other one :) .Imagine the embarrassment at showing up at the same buffet ,every other day ! And have to say most of them are similarly priced and probably have similar food range ,but after multiple sampling at other indian buffets I have to say that this one has more options,maybe a little bit cleaner and definitely the most spacious  in town. And would recommend it to anyone who wants to get away from ridiculously priced buffet at the big nightclub restaurants , as long as you like indian food . As for the negative stuffs , the ambience could be better , i mean they could decorate the walls a little bit better and play some decent music like some upscale places.Sometimes they have hard time catching up with the demand supply thing but i guess this being a new place ,its something they can work on.And  yes sometimes ,there is just that little extra oil floating around in the nan-bread or the curries, again something they can work on .All in all ,for an indian buffet ,it`s bang for bucks. And no I don`t own the place and have nothing against any other Indian buffets.

Reviews.Author: Revati
Reviews.Content: This buffet is very average. There were some items I liked and some that I didn't, but nothing wowed me.   The sitting area is large and they can hold a good volume of people. The staff was nice, but a little disorganized. We had to let a couple people know before we actually got our naan. The ambiance is very casual and it makes for a nice lunch place.  In the appetizers, the Tandoori Chicken was cold on the outside from sitting out so long and only tasted okay. The Shish Kabob was tasty, but not one of the kinds that I could keep eating. I had a couple pieces and was done. The Samosa, I would rave about. Though the filling had a little too much peas for my taste, they were really yummy. In most samosas, my favorite part is the little end where there is no filling and the dough is crunchy, and in this samosa, all of the dough tasted like that edge piece. Simply wonderful!  One really good thing about this place is that they deliver fresh naan to your table. Other buffets have the naan cut up as part of the buffet, but when there isn't a high turn around, you know those naans have been sitting for a while. Not the case at this place, they offered us plain or butter, but we asked for garlic and they obliged. It did take a little while for the naan to actually come out after we had ordered it, but it more than made up for the wait with the quality.   The main dishes is where I was most disappointed with this buffet. Chicken Makhani was pretty good. It had good layers of flavor. Unfortunately, at they tray seemed like the chicken pieces were either very small or had been picked through by other guests. The Chicken Curry had no flavor, and I only ate a little. There were a couple of vegetarian options, which was good to see for the vegetarian folk out there. I'm not a fan of brinjal, so I didn't try that, but I did try the Chana Masala, which was decent, although, not my favorite. All in all, there was nothing super exciting in terms of the main dishes.  For desert, I tried both the Gulab Jamun and the Kheer. The Kheer wasn't sweet enough for my taste. The Gulab Jamun, on the other hand, was pretty spot on. They were nice and warm too!  Overall, this buffet did not hold up to its reputation, but it was a good value for the amount of food that you get for the price you pay.

Reviews.Author: Francisco
Reviews.Content: First off me and my girlfriend LOVE this place they always have new dishes every time we go but they always keep the fan favorites. The food is always warm and fresh. They are sometimes a little slow on bringing the naan bread at times but they always refill your water right away. We have went so many times now they ask us how our life has been going if we haven't been in a while just a overall very pleasant experience. Good food, Nice people and a clean place what more can you ask for?!

Reviews.Author: Launce
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed this. Everything was good. Spicy was properly spicy and unlike some other Indian joints, the chutneys were rapidly produced to mitigate the heat. (I've heard that chutney is English more than Indian, but I do not care: A good chutney is the perfect counterpoint to spicy Indian food.) The naan was perfect. I like the garlic naan best but either way, you're winning. We had chicken vindaloo and a lamb dish. Both were terrific. Plus a full bar and they know how to pour a drink! The service we had was terrific, even when (because I was stupid) I forgot to order our entrees, our wait person was patient with me and got the orders in immediately. I note that some of the reviews dinged them on this, but seriously, our service was well-neigh perfect.

Reviews.Author: Hiro
Reviews.Content: Lunch buffet was only $9.99! The best quoalit and great selection.  I want to try dinner soon.  Love it!  :)

Reviews.Author: Rabea
Reviews.Content: Order my food to go... BEST CHICKEN CURRY!! My new favorite place. I love Indian food!! Glad this place is open!! I've been waiting to eat here. The ambiance is really nice as well. Look forward to trying their buffet!!

Reviews.Author: Parasaran
Reviews.Content: Food was amazing! Went for brunch and it was awesome not authentic though but the taste was just awesome.

Reviews.Author: Abeer
Reviews.Content: Great food, great service, Krishna came to our table and got our review.  They were willing to accommodate our specific food requests. Food to table took some time but art cannot be rushed.  Compliments to the chef.

Reviews.Author: Tychi
Reviews.Content: I gave this place at three their naan-bread is not that greatat all I gave it to three overall because of the look of the restaurant. Service was okay and I realize why there was only three people inside. I will admit that there Teeka masala was awesome

Reviews.Author: Davann
Reviews.Content: Never order for delivery!! Ordered and they never showed up. Don't know how the food taste because I never received it.

Reviews.Author: Renee
Reviews.Content: Delicious food!  So much flavor!  Lots of variety.  Very friendly staff.  I enjoyed trying the mango lassi with my yelp check in!  The garlic naan bread is so yummy!!!!  Will be back soon!  Nice family restaurant.

Reviews.Author: Marzi
Reviews.Content: Excellent food and awesome service. Our server Krishna was one of the best we have ever experienced. We will definitely visit again.

Reviews.Author: Yi Lu
Reviews.Content: Came here with my bf and his friend. We were visiting Las Vegas for the 1st time and the friend really wanted to eat Indian food. So this place was the best choice to eat from the order restaurants.   The location was pretty easy to find. Although if you are coming from the side it can be a little difficult because the restaurant is hidden in the back corner. The server was pretty quick... too quick I say. She would come around and grab my bf's plate 1st before asking  are you done?    *sigh; honey you gotta ask if they're done before you take it*   The buffet in my case was pretty good. I like the chicken masala, to me it was good. The spinach (saag paneer but without the cottage cheese) * I think * had a little weird taste to it. The lamb dish was kinda hard and over cooked. The soup was pretty good (can't remember the name of the dish). The chicken tandoori was severely burnt and lacked spice and flavor. Samosas (vegetarian) were pretty good. They had a slight kick to them,which I liked.   From the guys side, they didn't like it. They say the chicken  was over cooked. The saag paneer was mixed with milk and it tasted bad. The Naan was dry, hard and slightly burnt but the dessert was okay ( the guys say it was the only dish that was good because it was brought rather than made). Overall if you're not a food analyst  will love it! But if you are one then  enjoy .  Also the manager doesn't really care about its customers, he could have at least asked if the food was alright, instead like most business people, Money 1st (pay 1st) ask questions maybe later.... or never.

Reviews.Author: Saketh
Reviews.Content: The Guy Krishna, was awesome, Food is really nice and Good..!! Its a good place for eating spicy food..!!

Reviews.Author: Dina
Reviews.Content: My coworker and I went here for lunch today because the Mint was too busy.  We arrived around 12:20pm, and the pickings were scarce. No naan. No pokora. They were out and didn't replenish for 1/2 hour. Lentil soup was watery. I think the most aggravating thing was they were just plain out of items and did not replace the whole 30+ minutes I was there. They also have the nerve to kick up the price 2.00 more for lunch. You can't do that if you can't back up the price increase. This was by far one of the worst buffets I have been to. When I complained about the lack of essentials when I went to pay, there was no apology, no  let me take the drinks off.  Nothing. A blank stare. I will never go here again. Save your money and take it to the Mint where the food is delish and FULL buffet ALL the time.

Reviews.Author: James
Reviews.Content: tell you 1 hour in delivery time comes to you in 2 hours and 10 mins, the take out servings are less then half of the real serving spent 80 dollars on 5 people and we order 2 pizzas form pizza-hut afterwards, the food tasted so-so not that happy with it specially with the price  and the greedy fat delivery man demanded a tip. before kick him out with 2 dollars

Reviews.Author: Kannan
Reviews.Content: Slightly on the expensive side for dinner buffet, good options for people who love meat, but usual/not much different options for people who don't eat meat.   Price would be what that could prevent me from going back.

Reviews.Author: Catherine
Reviews.Content: The Lamb Briyani took us by surprise, it was super delicious!!!

Reviews.Author: Johnathan
Reviews.Content: This review is from ordering off their menu, not the buffet.  I came here at night and ordered chicken masala and samosa. The chicken masala was over cooked and dry. No flavor at all. The appetizer that they delivered at first was the wrong order and burnt on top of it. The samosa was okay, but again the seasoning was poor and there were 2 big ones for 5 dollars, which is pricey for the quantity.   It took me awhile to get the food, and I had to get the waiters attention just to place the order. They weren't that busy, so it was disappointing. The place looks nice. The food tasted like buffet quality, and I have had better buffet food to be honest. My bill came to around 20 dollars.

Reviews.Author: Amilah
Reviews.Content: I do not consider myself an expert in Indian food at all.  I just know what tastes good.  I'm from Southern California, and there are 2 authentic Indian food restaurants where I'm from.  Delhi Indian Cuisine is right there in line with them.  I love their food, the servers and even owner are very nice.  They always ask you how the food is.  I come here so much that I'm almost a regular.  I haven't been to the lunch buffet yet, I've only eaten dinner here.  The portions are huge enough for two people.  I love this place

Reviews.Author: Brenton
Reviews.Content: Grand opening tomorrow. They had a soft opening on New Year's Eve. I was presently surprised at how lovely the place was on the inside. It's dimly lit and makes for an intimate experience. They have a GREAT selection on the buffet for anyone's taste; several options for vegetarians and meat lovers. They even had biriyani on the buffet line, which I am a big fan of.   The place is very spacious and has a contemporary layout with soothing music playing. It makes you feel like you are really in a high end restaurant, but you realize that it's a high end buffet with great food instead. I'm told they will offer a full bar in the near future which is unique for an establishment like this.  I had no complaints. The staff were accommodating and received prompt service. I will definitely be back.   I just need to work off the 20k+ calories I just injected into my body first after I take a much needed nap. Not smart planning on my apart considering it's the evening of New Years Eve. Oh well. We live and learn.

Reviews.Author: Raghuveer
Reviews.Content: Extremely slow service. There were 5 people who were supposed to take orders but were wandering aimlessly, just passing a  stare and moving to the next table  We had ordered Naan and biryani Once the food arrived, it was extremely spicy even though the order was supposed to be moderate spicy. To top this experience, when we shared this feedback to the restaurant guy, his answer to eat naan with a bit of curd. Must be kidding right?  Very pricey, extremely slow service Not worth it..

Reviews.Author: Shashank
Reviews.Content: Goat curry was amazing, great blend of spices . Enough quantity of meat too. Service was pleasant and courteous. Masala papad was also good. Place has modern decor and comfortable seating.

Reviews.Author: Ananda
Reviews.Content: They must have changed cooks.  The new food was too spicy for the kids.  We will not be going there again.  They need to have Golan Jamin too.

Reviews.Author: Sainadh
Reviews.Content: Food was very tasty.Excellent customer service.clean and pleasant.I will recommend this restaurant to my friends.....

Reviews.Author: Candace
Reviews.Content: The Skinny: the Nepalese/East Indian cuisine is very satisfying... not to mention great piping hot naan that is perfectly crispy on the bottom with a slight chew. Only sad thing is that they do not consistently have kheer which is my fav. (4) service: always pretty good - water glasses are filled consistently (4) value: for $11.99, the lunch buffet is a great value - good for groups due to the large dining room (4).  This is our new go-to Indian Buffet joint in town. Sporting a good variety of items, they offer both Nepalese/East Indian flavors. The dining room is spacious and is capable of serving large groups of people comfortably.  Service is usually pretty good and your water glass is never left unfilled.  My favorite items include the saag paneer, chana masala and the aloo gobi. So delicious and usually always there. Their raita is nice and thick. They do not have chutney available as a condiment however the tamarind sauce does okay in a pinch. The tandoori chicken is quite moist and tasty as well. The hubs is addicted to their butter chicken and daal.  Their naan is great - loved the crispy bottom with the slight chew. Order it with garlic at no extra cost. Awesome!  Their one weakness in my opinion are the desserts. They have a rather artificial, watery mango  custard . This is in rotation with the vermicelli payasam which I found to be a bit too sweet and one note. I kind of miss the kheer using rice pudding and cardamom.  Overall, these are minor issues to an great buffet. 4 starred review.

Reviews.Author: Alex
Reviews.Content: This place has an amazing lunch buffet. All of the food tastes amazing and they keep it stocked.

Reviews.Author: Rakesh
Reviews.Content: Fantastic is the word... Have been in the States for the last six months and I can bet that this the best buffet lunch I've had. Absolutely authentic Indian.. Pls enjoy yr Indian cuisine here like my wife n I did.. Keep it going!

Reviews.Author: Devesh
Reviews.Content: Delhi indian cuisine is by far the best indian buffet i have had and i have tried at least 4 of them. There is enough variety and more importantly the taste is good to great for most part.  The malai kebab and the goat curry wrre excellent and so were the naans. The only thing i could complain about if i wanted to nitpick was the raita and panjabi kadhi being too sour for my taste.  If you are in vegas, dont miss this buffet.

Reviews.Author: Nicolette
Reviews.Content: One word, delicious.  If you can read more than one word, then read on my friend cause this is one of the best Indian restaurants that I've been to.   Some hobknobs might find the location a bit shady, but the interior of the restaurant is clean and well put together and makes you forget about all the bums across the street. Whataraya gonna do? Amirite?  This place has only been opened a week or so. The service here was good. While the waiters were new and seemed untrained in the usual customer service/waiter chatter, (family owned restaurant I assume?), they were still very polite and attentive, and boxed our food to-go for us. No complaints from me, they refilled my water glass often as I slew down all that spicy curry.  Good news for all vegetarians, half the menu is vegetarian based, which put me in a chipper mood right off the bat when we entered. They also have multiple chicken and lamb entrees if you're still craving the meat food. For me not actually being a big fan of curry, the food was amazing and I ate till I was beyond stuffed. I forgot the names of the dishes we selected, but I had a nine vegatable combo with mild spicy creme curry and my boyfriend had the traditional chicken curry. Both were just right in hotness and didn't leave a chalky taste in my mouth like most curry does.  The grand finaleeeee....Naan bread. mmm yes, that's right. the garlic naan bread here is so delicious I just wanted to go adopt a new puppy or something. Was so good that I got another frisbee shaped bread slice to-go.  With all that and an extra bowl of rice, the price for two was pretty decent. We ate there during the dinner hours where they gave us a menu, but they also do a lunch buffet which I have yet to try. I plan on coming back here as this place has awakened my curry craving. I'm getting hungry just typing about it.

Reviews.Author: Angie
Reviews.Content: Never had Indian food tried it for the first time . It was good experience staff was great friendly and polite. I d go back in the future to try the lunch buffet.

Reviews.Author: Ashish
Reviews.Content: This is one  of the best Indian buffets i have been to in USA. It's $14 but it's totally worth it. We were in Zion National Park for 4 days and really craving Indian food while on the way back to Vegas airport we stopped here and I am so glad we did. I had an awesome meal, there were 5 chicken dishes, a goat curry, 4-5 Indian dishes ( palak paneer, aloo mutter, korma etc) , nan and pulav. The only thing which I didn't like was gulab jamun which felt a little old but all in all a good restaurant. I will def visit again

Reviews.Author: Monk
Reviews.Content: Pretty good! The buffet is good and has a lot of vegetarian options. They could definitely spice up the options a bit (after all, most people who want Indian food want spicy food) and they could definitely mellow out on the salt. Way too salty!   Very friendly service. It's also a lot nicer, bigger, and cleaner than you would guess from the outside.   I'll be back :)

Reviews.Author: Crocodile Dundee
Reviews.Content: Came here for buffet with friends, and boy it was amazing. Indian buffet was only $9.99. This is the cheapest buffet in town. Everything is tasty, they have 5 vegetarian and 5 non vegetarian options. They even put out tandoori chicken and chicken kabab together. Gulab Jamun for buffet thats crazy, never have i seen someone put gulab jamun for buffet.

Reviews.Author: Andrea
Reviews.Content: Great indian buffet!!!! Will definitely be going back when in Vegas!!! Lots of choices to choose from. Don't know the name but the carrot dessert was delicious!!!!! Best I've had!

Reviews.Author: Darshan
Reviews.Content: We went there for dinner.  We were surprised to see lot of empty tables around 9:00/9:30 PM. But the food was good. The Mango Lassi was no good.  If you want to try Indian food after a long day in Vegas, This is a good Restaurant you can visit.  The service was really good.

Reviews.Author: Glenvy
Reviews.Content: One of my favorite places to go for AYCE Indian lunch buffets. Staff is friendly & efficient. I love the decor as well! Consistent, delicious & great customer sevice

Reviews.Author: Debbie
Reviews.Content: Had lunch here. The buffet had a great selection and the food was yummy.. Great flavor - love the mango lassi and the chicken curry.. Very nice ambience- kinda simple but I'm all about the food.. I recommend this place..

Reviews.Author: Saravanan
Reviews.Content: Best indian food at lasvegas as of I know.. saffron is next to this one.. earlier I was thinking li mm e saffron is best but after trying here I changed my best option to here.. lot of varities and good food at las vegas

Reviews.Author: Alexis
Reviews.Content: Amazing chicken tikka masala! Craved Indian food for two months and this was just the place to go. first time coming here and truly blown away

Reviews.Author: D.
Reviews.Content: Excellent service delicious chicken tandoori veggies crisp hey im tryna write like a food critic i enjoyed myself I will be back.

Reviews.Author: Jennifer
Reviews.Content: This place was so horrible!!  I love Indian food and had it bookmarked for a while.  I was excited to suggest hitting it up to 2 of my good friends for dinner end of business day.   I arrived first and it was empty and cavernous.  I ordered a cocktail while waiting for my friends.  15 minutes went by and my first friend arrived and still no cocktail. I was the only one there!  It was forever before she finally brought my drink and when she did it was the wrong cocktail. I explained it was a goose and side of fresh lemon juice the first time. She brought out a goose and a fresh lemonade.  When I told her it was wrong she totally copped an attitude with me, then went back to the bar only to make another wrong cocktail which was goose and a lemon soda!   When I told her she got it wrong yet again she told me she's never had somebody in there like me and she started yelling in her native language to another of her associates... and clearly it was about me lol    Then someone came out of the kitchen, we believe it was an owner, and started accusing her of stealing keys.  It turned into an all out screaming match in the middle of the restaurant.  I mean take it outside!  The cooks even came out of the kitchen to get ring side seats, eagerly awaiting the blood shed.   Our friend finally arrived in the midst of the insanity. It was like an episode of cops was unfolding before our very eyes.  We exited the establishment post haste.    Unfortunately we never tried the food but the ambience or lack there of leads me to want to leave a negative star rating, but I have to give it a one to post.  Needless to say it's erased from my bookmarks forever!  I was ashamed it was my suggestion in the first place. My friends definitely applauded me for the stellar recommendation lol

Reviews.Author: jason
Reviews.Content: i've gone back a few more times for the lunch buffet and its still fantastic. only wish they offered a dinner buffet atleast once a week.

Reviews.Author: Ife
Reviews.Content: I LOVE this buffet! And that's saying something, because I have been a die hard fan of Mint for some time now, but.... I gotta give props to Delhi, mainly because of CUSTOMER SERVICE!  There is one guy, HARI! He is amazing. The first time, we came here as a huge group for Norm's UYE, and despite there being around 14 of us, he made sure our glasses and Nan were never empty! Very attentive, and always on it.  The next time I visited, I brought my mother. Again, Hari made sure to come over and check on us, chit chat a bit, and make sure we had everything we needed. I reminded him that I came with the huge Yelp group, and he gave me a warm welcome back.  All the food is fabulous, and if you come during the early daytime rush, it is VERY fresh. Yes, there will be a bit more people there, but it's worth the wait.  My favorites from the buffet include the Goat Curry, the Navratan Korma, Gulab Jamun and the Tandoori Chicken. Mmm, just writing about it now is making my mouth water. And that's just a short listing of all the choices Delhi has to offer on any given day.  You have to go and try for yourself. Make sure you say hi to Hari for me!

Reviews.Author: Tushar
Reviews.Content: Pathetic food. We ordered chilly chicken, chicken momos, dal makhni, karahi chicken and bhunna ghost. All except chilly chicken was worse indian you could have. First, waiter forgot our order. Bhunna ghost was uncooked. Karahi chicken had excessive salt. Dal was bland. One of the worst meal I ever had in US. Breads were not up to the mark. Washrooms were in bad condition.  What else do you expect from a resturant.  Eat at your own risk !!

Reviews.Author: Yliana
Reviews.Content: We came here for dinner and ordered from the regular menu, as buffet is only available during lunch. Appetizers were generally priced at about $5, and entrees range from about $11 - $15. So it is a little pricey, but the portions were generous. We ordered vegetable pakora, saag panner, tandoori chicken, and aloo gobi. We also got a free Mango Lassi for our Yelp check-in, and complimentary Galub Jamuns for dessert (served warm)! My husband and I were both full by the time we left, and we had enough left over for lunch the next day.   The food was absolutely delicious and the staff was very nice. There place was pretty empty, only about 5 tables were occupied, so the staff was very attentive - asking if we needed more water, and checking to make sure we were enjoying our meal.   I'll definitely be coming back here - only next time I hope I can make it for the $10.99 buffet lunch!!

Reviews.Author: Sana
Reviews.Content: We go to Vegas a lot from Los Angeles.. I was a fan of Ghandi since last 8 years.... I think I found my new fav... Food and service was great...

Reviews.Author: jovan
Reviews.Content: Such good food!! The chicken tikka masala was amazing. Definitely will be coming here again.

Reviews.Author: Stephen
Reviews.Content: Never had Indian food before. Friends recommended I give this place a chance, and I loved it. Spice level on everything is perfect for me, and the bread must be foreign to earth cause it's on another level.

Reviews.Author: Andrew
Reviews.Content: Funny enough, I thought I knew all the Indian restaurants near UNLV. But this was new. The exterior is unassuming enough and fits into the surrounding businesses like a leaf on grass. But once you enter inside it looks pretty nice and clean. What I noticed was how big this place was. My go to place for Indian is Everest, but my friend told me to try this place and I did.  The service is quiet but friendly and very quick. I give the food a 3-3.5 star but the service moves it over.  Ok, stop your yammering Andrew. What about the grub? The food is actually spicier than most other Indian restaurants I been to. The butter chicken is probably the tamest entree there. Well, that and the pre-requisite tandoori chicken. My favorite go to is always tandoori chicken and goat. And that's what I went for. The tandoori chicken was pretty dry. I wasn't sure if it was the Hoover Dam drought effects but i shrugged that off and notched it against Delhi. The goat is very tender and tasty. The butter chicken is very delicious. I also had the other spiced chickens like curry. It was good but not memorable enough for me to remember much about that foul. The eggplant was cooked well but man oh man it had some spice to it. A bit too much for a rather bland vegetable if you ask me. Sometimes the veggie is best left natural with a bit of seasoning. To me, this is one of them.  My regular rice pudding dessert was a bit different, it had vermicelli noodle bits in it....glass noodle for the noodlers out there. The fruit and desserts were minimal. If you like sweets, they had this glutinous ball that was swimming in honey water. Sweet and delicate. Try it.  I did not eat the different varieties of rice there but it looked good enough. The nan bread was brought out piping hot and had garlic and cilantro in it. It was fresh and tasted great, especially after dipping it in the butter chicken sauce.  AYCE lunch was about $10. There is quite a variety but I think I will stick closer to home and go to Everest.  Business seemed pretty slow so I hope it was because we lunched at 1:30.  I will mention one more thing. There were a little too many black things in the rice pudding. Maybe 2. Imma tell myself that it was some sort of spice. It wasn't a bug. I rubbed it on the table and it was more like lint. A bug would break apart. The better half thinks it's spice so I'll go by that. She did notice that it had quite a bit of it on the tray as well. I am Chinese but an extra added bonus of tiny bug is persona non grata.

Reviews.Author: Mimi
Reviews.Content: Really good food and nice environment. Manager was friendly. Naan was fresh made. A good Indian Buffet at Las Vegas.

Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: We ate here in August and with Indian food being one of our most favorite ethnic styles, we jumped at the chance to try out Delhi Indian Cuisine.   The menu contained numerous items that were new to us, and we started things off with a Mango Rum Lassi. The alcohol was a nice addition and did not overpower the sweetness of the lassi. For my main course I had the  Kadhai Paneer and enjoyed every bite. My wife had the Chicken Xacuti. I'll let her write about that in her review (she liked it). We shared the kashmiri naan and used it to scoop up the great food.   Would love to come back for the buffet.  Side note, be careful in the parking lot, there was a taxi that flew by us not once but twice and darn near hit our rental car. :",
